I had shouted at my younger brother and he was always afraid when 
I called out loudly.

On days when I feel close to my partner and other friends. 
When I feel at peace with myself and also experience a close 
contact with people whom I regard greatly.

Every time I imagine that someone I love or I could contact a 
serious illness, even death.

When I had been obviously unjustly treated and had no possibility 
of elucidating this.

When I think about the short time that we live and relate it to 
the periods of my life when I think that I did not use this 
short time.

At a gathering I found myself involuntarily sitting next to two 
people who expressed opinions that I considered very low and 
discriminating.

After my girlfriend had taken her exam we went to her parent's 
place.
When, for the first time I realized the meaning of death.

When a car is overtaking another and I am forced to drive off the 
road.

When I recently thought about the hard work it takes to study, and 
how one wants to try something else. When I read a theoretical 
book in English that I did not understand.
When I found a bristle in the liver paste tube.
When I pass an examination which I did not think I did well.

When one has arranged to meet someone and that person arrives 
late, in the meantime one starts thinking about all that could 
have gone wrong e.g a traffic accident.
When one is unjustly accused of something one has not done.
When one's studies seem hopelessly difficult and uninteresting.

When one finds out that someone you know is not at all like one 
had thought, for instance friends who steal and things like that, 
quite unwarranted.
Passing an exam I did not expect to pass.

When I climbed up a tree to pick apples. The angle of the ladder 
I was on did not enable me to get high enough. This implied 
that the ladder was not very stable.
When I had my children.

When my 2 year old son climbed up and sat on the 7th floor 
balcony with his legs hanging out. He was holding on tightly to 
the upper railing of the balcony but he could have easily lost 
his balance when he sat down.
When my partner was attacked and lost three teeth.

When I see children on T.V from areas devastated by drought and 
war.
When I nearly walked on a blindworm and then saw it crawl away.
When my child was born.

It was spring and the ice was melting. I was far out on a jetty and I poked the ice with a long branch to try and break it.
The branch went through the ice and I fell in, the water closed 
in over my head.
Unjust accusations directed at me and my way of acting, by someone close to me.
Failing an examination.

A drunkard fell, started bleeding and wet himself. Disgust that 
turned into sadness-unpleasantness.
When I saw a person I had not seen for a long time.
When, as a child, I was nearly knocked down by a car.

When I heard on the radio that the football match in Belgium had 
ended in a catastrophe, and several people had died. I could not 
understand how normal people could behave in such a way.

When I feel lonely, perhaps because I have to study a lot and I 
am shut up in my appartment. Nothing happens in particular 
because there is no time for anything else.

When one learns through the mass media all the wars and killing 
going on in the world.
When I was accepted for a course on finance and accounting.

A bus drove over my right leg. The event itself was not very 
frightening but when I had to wait in the emergency ward for 
three hours and then my leg began to swell, I was frightened.

At my Summer job, nobody looked after me in particular and I had 
to learn all on my own.
When I was not accepted as a student in finance and accounting.

When I had just moved into my new appartment I found a ventilator 
in the kitchen. I was going to clean it when I found that the 
drum was full of mud and slime. I felt disgusted.
Passed an exam by 2 points.
In a cottage in a large forest, I was alone for a while in the dark.
Railway station good-bye.

I saw a cripple in rags with small children in Italy. He was 
probably an imposter.
I passed an exam that I was absolutely certain that I had failed.

On the way back from Denmark with a friend on a small yatch, 
there was a storm and my friend was blown overboard; I was very 
scared till I managed to get him back onboard.
I locked myself out.
I missed the last tram home and had to walk in the pouring rain.
I found some worms in the food and I had obviously eaten some.
When I won a trip to Greece in a competition.

When I am out in the dark and a suspicious looking character 
comes towards me.

At work, when an elderly man complained unjustifiably about me and 
distrusted me.
When I had not understood anything after a lecture.
When an alcoholic stood dribbling over a food counter.

At a friend's birthday party with some of my closest friends. It 
was all very pleasant and one could say that I was happy to have 
such good friends.

On the way home one Friday night in the heavy rain the car 
acquaplanned. I lost contact with the road surface for a few 
seconds.
Mad at my dad.
A case of unrequited love.
A bad smelling cucumber.
I felt very happy when I won the football pools.

When I flew from Athens to Copenhagen after a holiday. The plane 
was caught in a storm and it began to shake and I thouhght that 
we were going to crash.
When someone stole my bike.

When I saw the list of books to read for an acccouting course, I 
thought " Oh God how will I ever manaage it!"

It was when I read a newspaper article on the future and they 
foresaw that we would be eating frog-burgers by the year 2000. 
An illustration showed a frog between two pieces of bread.

When the whole family gets together for a one week holiday. 
Everybody feels free and the trip is well planned. It works out 
well and we enjoy ourselves.
When friends try to put me down or hurt me.
Marriage crises. Boredom.
When someone makes advances that one does not want.
When I passed the first examination that I had to repeat.

When I drove to Stockholm for the first time and drove off the 
Stora Hissingen road at the wrong exit.
When my boyfriend went away for a month long holiday without me.

Last year when I worked during the Summer holidays and studied 
at the same time for an examination I had to repeat; my boyfriend 
went to Greece for a holiday for a month.
When a dog is left whining outside a shop.

The day I was told that I had been accepted as a student of 
economics.

While taking a short cut through the Vasa park, I was surrounded 
by three people who tried to steal my money. I was scared and 
was saved only by the appearance of other people.

At a restaurant I observed how the gypsies tried to get money by 
cheating the foreigners i.e non Swedish speaking. My anger had 
nothing to do with hatred against foreigners, but it was an 
expression of the anger I feel when I see people being used .

At the begining of a new course one is afraid of encountering 
problems one can not manage. Thoughts revolve around failing 
the subject and the consequences it would have for the future.

While walking in town I noticed how the police harrassed a man 
who was under the influence of alcohol. They terrified him with 
the thought of arrest by driving close behind him on a pedestrian 
street. My disgust was directed at the gestures and the facial 
expressions of the policemen; they seemed to be enjoying 
themselves.

When I found out that I had passed the last two exams by a 
margin of three marks.
When my father was ill and was waiting for the results of his tests.

When I got caught in the pouring rain last Thursday and did not 
have a raincoat on me.
When I failed an exam.

When I gave birth to my son and saw that he was alive and that I 
had managed it well. He was born a month too early with a 
malfunctioning lung. This happened a year ago.

When I found out that my father had lung cancer and they did not 
know how long he would live.

When a colleague asked me for help at work, despite the fact 
that he had more time to do it than I had.

When I did not get the salary increase that I had been expecting 
and understood how little one's work was appreciated.
When I was weeding the garden I found a lizard in my hand.

New year's eve 1983/1984, I met my girlfriend. We stood on the 
steps outside her parents home and I kissed her for the 
first time.

When I was stopped by plain clothes policemen because the car I 
was driving had overturned on the Avenue. I had been driving too 
fast, and I was afraid when I was stopped, questionned and then 
toild to go. The situation ended happily since there were no 
consequences.

The editor changed the heading of an article that I had written. 
He considered the heading to be derogatory towards the person I had written 
about.

A close acquaintance of the family died of lung cancer. 
Although it was expected, I still felt depressed.

When I saw a picture, in the Gothenburg Post, of a totally 
demolished car with two fatally injured passengers. The car was 
so badly damaged that they couldn't get the bodies out at the 
scene of the accident.
When I got the loan for my studies.

I met intoxicated people with dubious intentions in a back alley 
one Wednesday night.

On the T.V I saw a news feature on South Africa. A policeman 
attacked a group of black people with a whip.

The thought of having to read a boring book of 400 pages in 
English.
Grovelling people.

Observing someone in the cafeteria noisily gulping in his food, 
having extremely bad manners.

When my sister - after a history of one abortion and one 
stillbirth - gave birth to a perfectly healty boy.

When my sister had the still born child, she was emotionally very 
deep down, and it took her a long time to recover.

We were starting a student project, and the teacher we talked to 
was very negative and not very helpful.
When my boyfriend openly let me down, preferring another girl.

I felt some disgust for my boyfriend for a time, after he had 
left me.

Unexpected visit by a close friend, whom I hadn't seen for half a 
year.

I wandered by mistake into the safety zone of a shooting range, 
and was shot at.
Being treated unfairly.
Breaking up with a girl.
Nothing.

When I was accepted as a student at the college, not having 
thought it possible.

When I was the first to arrive at the scene after an accident, 
and found that a close school friend had been killed.

I was accused of having done something, which I hadn't and got 
very angry.
When my grandmother died.
Not applicable.

A couple of years ago during the summer holiday, I was fishing at 
a lake with my husband. Suddenly it started raining while the 
sun was still shining. I experienced a feeling of joy, happiness 
and fulfillment. the whole nature was full of music.

I was alone at home, in bed reading a womens' magazine in which 
there were storiees of paranormal experiences. My leg was 
itching and I stretched my hand to scratch and I felt another 
strange hand. (later I realized that it was the corner of the 
blanket)

I went to a lecture and once again it had been cancelled, this 
was the second time. One had a negative attitude towards the 
lecturer.

I heard that a former superior of mine had died, I was later at 
home home reading about it in the newspaper and I thought of our 
interaction and how it was no longer possible. The limited scope 
of human life is sad.

In the tram there was a fat, sickly looking woman in front of me 
who was asking for directions in a thick voice. When she got up to 
go a disgusting smell of urine came from her. I felt that I 
would choke.

I had a summer job in Sweden, and my boyfriend came to meet me on 
my birthday.

I went to practice in Sweden during summer, and I was afraid that 
I would not do well.

In the holiday cottage of our association, two of my pals came to 
wake me up early one morning by bringing a radio played at the 
highest volume into my room - it was the morning service at its 
loudest.
My grandmother died suddenly last summer.

My superior at the summer job swindled customers as much as he 
could, and once put me in a difficult situation after which I 
could not but detest him.

I was told quite unexpectedly that one wanted me to become the 
vice-chairman of our student organisation. I was really 
surprised and joy was the first emotion I felt, though behind it 
there was worry - how shall I succeed ?

Our tutorial group was soon to be divided, and we got a list of 
names of freshmen, out of which five were to be in my group. We 
read the names and then each group went its own way to a seminar 
room. I wondered how I would cope with the new situation and if 
I would succeed as a group leader.

We were in a disco and the evening was not at all pleasant. 
Despite my not knowing why, I was angry with my companion. I let 
him feel my bad humour as I cannot hide my feelings.

My grandmother died, and my mother called me one sunday morning 
in the Autumn. The way my mother told me about it, I hated her 
at that moment. She sounded as if she had been waiting for the 
death of my grandmother. I had lost a person close to me. I 
felt guilty too as I had been bad to my grandmother of late. I had not 
remained calm when she no longer understood everything so well.

At the underground station, a drunkard came to speak to me. He 
tried to ask me something but I did not answer so he began to 
speak about me with his companion. I detested this dirty 
growling man.

Last night I had a chat with a fellow student. I had known her 
for about half a year, and for the first time we were speaking 
"the same language"- meaning an inspiring discussion and 
encounter.

[ I sometimes quarrel with my mother because she blames me, 
though I have not in any way been connected to some events.]

After hearing about the death of my grandfather. First I could 
not believe it, but later I wept and felt the situation was 
hopeless. I felt lonely and wanted to be consolated.

In the evening, while I was watching TV, my little brother came 
in and started eating food he had brought from the kitchen while 
I was trying to concentrate on the program.

I met a dear friend of mine after a long time. I expressed my feelings 
in our own usual way, by mutual scolding and abusing (with 
complete understanding) and by touching, patting and taking the 
hand of the other person, etc...

I felt fear of the purest kind after a car accident. The 
incident and images of horror kept coming back to my mind. I 
wondered what could have happened to my sister, my friend and me, 
though nothing very serious actually happened.

Two boys whom I know were telling me, in an indecent manner, how 
they had teased a young and shy girl I know. They had despised 
her conviction, scorned and touched her. I got very angry and 
did not try to conceal it and gave it back to them.

My sweetheart left me, or rather we decided to break it off by 
mutual consent. The consequences were - unrestrained weeping, 
feelings of loneliness, hopelessness and disconsolation. I felt 
that I should find a friend, to talk to joyfully and to forget.

Out of sheer curiosity, I went to see a pornographic movie in 
Copenhagen. The room was full of men, who panted and 
masturbated. Very disgusting.
When I won a tennis match.
When my dog ran out on thin ice last spring.

When my tennis match was interrupted because a kid cycled right 
into the court.

Celebrations on the graduation day with the orchestra playing in 
the garden ( I am a part of this orchestra).
Risk of being involved in a fight after a party.

I had a very heavy work load and two colleagues, whom I have 
nothing against, disturbed me by "terror ringing", i.e 
continously interrupting me by telephoning.
After an exam which I failed.
When I met an old schhol friend (school love).

When I was cycling to school, I nearly got knocked down by a car 
which (overtook me too closely) did not give me any swerving space.

When I was deputy manager during the Summer, certain deputies 
took liberties, more than what was normal.

When I realized that my girlfriend, whom I like, and I were going 
to separate.
Dog dirt which thaws in the spring.
Passed the last exam.
Was nearly knocked down by a car.

I reached the bus stop and realized that I had forgotten my bus 
pass.

My current work load is too much. The feeling comes back from 
time to time.
When my one year old son gives me a spontaneous kiss.
When someone close to me is travelling by car and is delayed.
When someone does something wrong which affects me negatively.
When I think about my parents getting old.

An ex-colleague asked me if I was interested in working in their 
accounts bureau. They needed "clever people" and he had 
"immediately thought of me."

I was driving and a deer suddenly appeared in front of the 
car when there was a lot of traffic behind me.
I saw a report on T.V news on apartheid in South Africa.
When my girlfriend became pregnant.
When I nearly collided with another car.
The time when someone let the air out of the tyres of my cycle.
When I read a lot and did not remember anything.
Long illness.
When I passed an exam.

When I was travelling by tram, I tripped and fell against the 
door. I thought that I was going to fall out.
When I missed the tram after having run for it.
The inability to read a book at college.
If a guy one is not interested in makes advances.

I worked at a lawyer's office during Summer and I got a very 
good reference from him.

I had been watching a triller a dark night in the country and I 
had to go the outside toilet on my own.

When I am accused of something I have not done, I get unbelievably 
angry.

When I began to read a thick book, which I had a limited time to 
read. Also when I have a lot of work to do and I cannot keep up.
Someone vomited on the street.
When I was finally qualified for my profession.
Someone attacked me with a knife.
Someone drove into my car and then denied that it had happened.
When I was told that my friend's wife had cancer.
When I saw a dog which had been knocked down by a car.
I stopped working (had a boring job).

I was going home by car late one night when it was cold, dark and 
windy. I became rather panicky on the way to my house.
Quarrel in the family.

When I am alone in a room with no contact with anyone - 
loneliness drains me.
When I was on holiday someone vomited in front of me.
When I get a hug from someone I love.

I was driving very fast on a small road and I met an oncoming car 
in a right handed bend. The other driver was on his own side of 
the road and I had to skid out of it to avoid a collision. It 
was dark.

My car had been towed away by the traffic police because it had 
been wrongly parked. However the sign had been put up only after 
I had already parked.
After an operation I had to stay in bed for a long time.

I was forced to stay in the canteen and eat the food that I had 
not asked for but got it anyway.
When I won an unexpected sum of money.

My 2 year old daughter disappeared in a moment of inattention; I 
was responsible for her.

A colleague asked me for some advice and as he did not have 
enough confidence in me he asked a third person.

I wanted to be pregnant and did not succeed, so I was depressed 
at every menstruation.

In a warm bus full of people, someone vomited and the whole bus 
stank.

When I was at a party I met an old friend from an adult 
education course. We had not met for 2 years but had both thought 
a lot about each other. A wonderful experience.

When I was cycling through the park late one night, two people 
jumped out of the woods and tried to stop me. There were 
shouting something at the same time.

When close relatives tried to dissuade me from studying 
Psychology because of its low status.

I had a long discussion on politics with an acquaintance. He 
was more knowledgeable than me and I failed to explain my point 
of view and was misunderstood so I felt depressed and left.

When I read a newspaper article on a young girl who had been 
raped and assaulted one night by several men when she was unconscious.
When I recently got an appartment in central Gottenburg.
When I saw a large spider crawling up the wall.

My employer took too many aspirins for a bad back and also drank 
an enormous amount of spirit. This was dangerous and he did 
not understand that he had done anything wrong.
When I left New York, and all my family and my friends behind me.

When I slept with a guy because my best friend wanted me to. 
He had never had intercourse with anyone and had a terrible 
complex about it.

When my son returned from mountaineering - healthy in body and 
soul.

When one meets new people with whom one is forced to collaborate 
with.

The sports fishermen who catch gulls instead of fish with their hooks. 
It is often a mistake but it makes me angry.
I feel sad about an event I can not influence.

When a member of the family complains about the food that is 
served, it disgusts me.

When I was informed that I had been accepted as a student of 
Psychology.

When I was in a little fishing boat and we ran into hard weather 
in the open sea.

When I found out that the guy I was dating at a particular time 
had a steady relationship going on with someone else for a long 
time.
I felt sad and depressed when I heard that our cat had died.

When I was working as a nurse in a mental hospital, a patient ate 
up the contents of another patient's spitoon.
When I was acceptted as a student of psychology.
When my son has a pain in his leg (for no apparent reason).

When, after a week at school, a teacher sent a note home saying 
that my son was inattentive and unable to do his lessons.

When I thought that it was going to be impossible for me to start 
studying (due to wrong information from the student advisor).

At a certain person's lack of cleanliness, at home and 
personally.
When my son was born.

When I nearly drowned in icy water wearing ice skates. It was 
difficult to get out.

When I was pointed out as a problem child in primary school and 
my mother took the teacher's point of view.
When I was accused of neglecting work for the wrong reasons.

My parents attitude towards each other when they should become 
reconciled, despite my father's long-time addiction.

When after 10 months of national service I was "downgraded" and 
did not have to do the remaining 5 months.

When I was reprimanded by the manager of the hotel where I 
worked during Autumn 1984.

When my parents drove me to a nearby place and went home 
immediately instead of waiting a few hours. They could have 
easily waited.

When my ex-girlfriend and I discovered that there was a certain risk 
of her being pregnant.

When I was about to clean the draining board and saw it looked 
underneath the sink (I live in a students hostel).

When my older sister told us that she was thinking of joining the 
rest of the family for the winter sports holiday.

Slept in a chapel and in the middle of the night I realized that 
there was someeone else in the chapel. I never discovered who 
it was and why he was there.

When we were in high school a few guys sometimes provoked a 
friend of mine. They called her a pig and then grunted. This 
irritated most of the girls. Once, one of the girls got angry at 
my friend and said something nasty and this made me terribly 
angry.

I talked to my boyfriend on the phone when I was in high spirits 
and had a lot to tell him. I had been looking forward to this 
conversation and he did not listen to me to the extent that I 
had anticipated.
A mother who shouts at her child for nothing.
When I got through the first day here at the department.

When I was cycling past a parked car someone opened the door and 
nearly pushed me off my bike and into the traffic.

When my boyfriend sat up half the night playing computer games 
with a friend.
When I had to leave my mother and my sister after a week's visit.
When I saw a big spider from very close.
When i was asked to be a child's godmother.
On the way down a ski slope which was difficult and steep.
When my mother interfered in my life.

When I was left alone one week-end without being prepared for 
it.

The first time that I saw a surgeon cut off a leg and put it in a 
black rubbish bag.

When my husband suddenly came to see me at my new job and 
brought some flowers and cake with him.
When I was nearly attackad by a man who had been chasing me.

When my father asked me if I was a communist, at the same time he 
made it clear that I should no longer see myself as his daughter.

When I applied for a job which I thought I had a good chance of 
getting, I was not even granted an interview and did not get the 
job.
T.V features showing the violation of defenceless people.

When we were able to afford a new sofa - a leather one which cost 
SEK 20000. I had waited for it for 2-3 years.
Vertigo - standing on a ladder and painting the house.

When my boss enrolled in a course to satisfy his own ends - to 
trample on his associates. I have the misfortune to have one of 
my superiors in my course.

When I argue with my mother about the way she treats her two 
children differently.
Spit and vomit.

When I recently managed to get my first consulting assignment 
"myself" i.e on my own initiative.

I was within a hair's breadth of knocking down a drunkard who 
suddenly ran into the street. The fear came later when I 
realized what could have happened.

When my friend, as usual, forgot the tickets at home for a 
performance. We missed it.

The elections of 1982 and 1985. The thought of what a social 
democrat and communist majority could achieve, especially "worker 
share" funds and its extension.

A study visit to a chicken factory : the butchery, the smell, 
the environment and the noise.

When I was appointed to position of trust in a group set up to 
change the working environment.

I was alone in a cottage I often stay in. I was woken up by a 
rustling sound in the middle of the night.

When I tried to explain to a plumber, face to face, that the 
toilet was broken and he did not believe it (it had been mended 
ten times).

When the result of a project work was treated nonchalantly 
intead of being criticized by the teacher.
When programmes on violence or pornography are shown on T.V.

After my girl and I talked things over our relationship changed 
and became positive. A diificult time turned into pleasant one.

When we could not land our plane and we knew that the fuel was 
running out. Bad weather had already frightened us.

When I read about Reagan's tactical decision concerning the 
South African boycott.

When my half brother became seriously ill with cancer and died 
later.

A film were a woman was attacked and raped. One did not see the 
worst but it had the desired effect - very strong.

When I was offered a high position of trust, which I later 
accepted.

I had the window open and the door was shut so that the kitten 
would not go out. My partner came in and started talking about 
something and I forgot about the window and suddenly I saw the 
kitten hanging from the window frame. I was rigid with fright 
till I got hold of her.

Some noisy guests arrived at the hotel. I had been slightly 
irritated earlier. At night when I was trying to sleep they were 
having a party so I went and yelled at them. I wanted to sleep 
as I had to get up early the next day.

When I was told that I had not been successful in getting the job I 
had been expecting. I was sure that I was sufficiently 
qualified.

When my cat vomited and a worm came out which was still alive. I 
was forced to wipe it up.

[ Cycling in the spring sunshine gives me such delight. 
Happiness is to be healthy, my wonderful finance. Simply being 
here on earth.]

When my relationship with my family is very poor I often fear 
being excluded from the group, a fear which is stronger in 
situations when an argument is on hand.

Recently when my sister, who is four years younger than me and 
very spoiled, shouted at my mother for no apparent reason . The 
heart-broken expression on my mother's face made me feel very 
angry.

When I watched the T.V programme called "The living planet" and 
saw the far reaching environmental destruction caused by man.

Disgust is a feeling that I have never experienced with peoplie 
but , on the other hand, it has been with repulsive animals, i;e 
snakes on T.V.

On a boat trip to Denmark, 14 of us had a lot of fun and we 
spent SEK 10 each on one armed bandits and against all odds we 
won the jackpot of SEK 1000.

A rainy day, I was cycling downhill and a car door suddenly 
opened and while trying to avoid it the back wheels of my bike 
got caught in the tram tracks. I somersaulted but had no 
injuries.

On the way home from Marstrand I was driving behind my father's 
car. Another car tried to push in front of my father and he was 
forced to swerve and he thus collided the car with a pillar. The 
other car drove off without even seeing what had happened.

My girlfriend who had spent 6 months abroad broke off our 
relationship by letter.

At the police centre a man between 40-50 was brought in. He was 
very drunk and in all likelihood had not slept indoors for a long 
time and had relieved himself in his trousers.

When I was at the end-of-term party last week and had fun - was 
happy and sang and drank only soft drinks. It is possible to 
have a good time without alcohol.

Last Summer I was walking along the beach in a bikini and an 
awful man came cycling after me. He was shouting and I ran as 
fast as my legs could carry me.

In a course I thought that I deserved good marks but I only got 
ordinary marks with no justification as to why I was given these 
marks.

When I crashed my car and it had to be scrapped then. It was my 
fault and I feel depressed as I miss the car.

I had some sort of a stomach virus last week and I vomited in 
college in the morning, then in the cake shop, three times during 
the trip home and again when I got home.
When I felt that my love was returned.

When I was convinced that someonne had broken into my flat and I 
woke up and heard sounds that frightened me.

When it became clear that a man had used many people sexually 
and psychologically, despite the fact that many people looked up 
to him. I understood that one could not trust him and I was 
forced to hide this for a while.

When I feel helpless after having tried to help someone without 
any result.

When I think now about the way my father behaved when filing a 
divorce.

When I recently got a very positive answer from a clinic telling 
me that they would willingly assist and collect data for me for a 
clinical pilot study.
Every time I meet a certain dog that has once bitten me.

When after a lot of provocation my child threw a plate on the 
floor.

When I realized that I could not communicate properly with my 
closest friend.

When I tried to explain to my child as to why there were 
magazines wiith naked girls on them at the kiosk.

When I began dansing, the teacher came and told me that I was 
very good and would soon get into the ballet academy.

A late Saturday night I found myself locked in the central 
underground station of Stockholm with a group of 50 hard rockers 
who were drunk and equipped with various kinds of chains, etc.

When I was forced to call the telephone company about a bill 
concerning a disconnected phone belonging to my landlord. The 
bill was four months overdue and in the meanwhile he had been 
using my phone, he seemed to have no intention of having his own 
phone reconnected.

Whenever I read or think about the way people treat animals and 
nature.

When I saw a T.V programme on animals in the film world 
(mistreated and used).
When my 6 month old son is happy and well.

A four year girl ran away from her father straight in front of my 
car. I was forced to use the emergency brakes.
[ After an examine I had been satisfied with.]
When a colleague failed to contact me at the arranged time.
When I read racist slogans on the walls.
When I gave birth to a healthy boy.

When my husband and I spent a night by ourselves in a house which 
was in an area on the outskirts of a large town with which we were 
not familiar. We heard strange noises outside the house and the 
house had glass walls so the whole thing was even more 
frightening.

Jealous of my husband's old girlfriend. We met her with her 
husband and there was a lot of reminiscing.

When my daughter had problems with her friends and I could see 
her predicament from the window. She was given a the cold 
shoulder.

When I was an auxiliary nurse at the hospital and I had to change 
the nappies, for the first time, of a very old and sick woman.

When my husband and I decided to take a few days holiday after a 
particularly trying period.

Before a hospital visit prior to a D&C under anasthesia for an 
expected miscarriage.
Exchange of points of view with my sister on a family matter.
Treatment to become pregnant with a negative result.

When I woke up one morning and went to the kitchen I discovered 
that our dog had diarrhoea. There were small "piles" all over 
the floor and the smell was choking.

When I gave birth to a child and saw that it was normal when it 
was put against my breast.

During labour when the foetal sounds became faint and there was a 
big alert for a forceps delivery.

At a cash desk where I had gone to buy 16 rolls of kitchen paper 
at a reduced price. After queuing with screaming children; it 
turned out that I had taken two 8 roll packets instead of the one 
16 roll packet to which the rebate applied. The assistant said 
"You will have to get it another time."
When I first heard that Tage Dannielsson had died.
The lift of Stockholm central station stank of vomit and urine.
The high school entrance exam.
A gang of screaming and drunk youths "captured" a tram.

An unjust refree decision at a sports event when I was the team 
leader.
When my girlfriend left me.

I was dominated by a certain person and even though I knew it I 
could not change my own reactions.

Yesterday, when the final whistle blew at the final match between 
OIS and IFK and it was certain that OIS had won the Swedish 
title.

I was teaching someone to drive and when we were about to crash I 
was scared.

A drummer who had borrowed my drums destroyed both the drumskin 
and the sticks. He did not repair them nor did he tell me about 
it.

When my dad gives priority to my kid brother's band and his 
other activities. We both play in different bands and rehearse 
in my parents garage.

A friend unjustly put the blame on me to relieve his conscience 
and also spread lies for the same purpose.

When I dived among sharks and the brightly coloured fish on the 
outer reef of Tvavni, Fidgi.

When I missed crashing, by a hair's breadth, into a man who came 
out 20 metres ahead of me when I was driving at 110km/h.

When I told off a computer teacher who did not want to teach me 
beacause of prejudice.
When I could not do anything because of a bad back.

When I discovered that the house we had hired in Tonga was full 
of cockroaches.

When I passed the driving test three weeks ago and got my 
licence.

When the car I was driving skidded on an icy road and landed in 
a ditch with one side against a rock.
When I met friends I had not seen for the last 2-4 years.
When a guy chased me when I was out jogging.
When the morning newspaper has not arrived.

I feel unbelievably happy about the relationship between my 
boyfriend and me, it is a reoccurring feeling.
A reoccurring fear that something will happen to my relatives.

When I argue with my boyfriend, I feel as though he feels 
superior to me.

When I failed an exam last Summer. I had worked very hard for it 
and I was very disappointed thinking that it was hopeless to 
continue at college. I did overreact.
I was very happy when I got an attractive Summer job.
The birth of my child.

When I have to leave the baby in the carriage and go shopping, I 
fear that something will happen to the baby.

When during Winter the water pipes froze and we did not have any 
water for two days.
I did not quite succeed in breast feeding my baby.
The smell of garlic in rush-hour bus.

During the Christmas holidays, I met some of my old friends, 
after not having seen them for six months.

We were driving a car of a friend of mine when we turned in the 
wrong direction towards an unknown district, and nearly drove 
down a precipice.

When our religion teacher presented shocking sectarian thoughts 
and doom's day as official teaching.
My grandfather died, when I was an exchange student in the USA.

I happened to see the video-tape movie "This is America - Part 
one" at my friend's place.

In the underground's escalator, a youngish bum asked me for 
money. Although I did not give him anything, the fellow told me 
that I was really good-looking. A man who was in front of me 
also turned to look at me.

I was afraid of moving away from home and moving to Helsinki for 
my studies.

In the student kitchen that we share, somebody drank from my 
juice pot (one litre) so that I only got one glass out of the 
whole pot.
My father gave money to my brother but not to me.

During the week-end at home, my mother fries greasy and unhealthy 
meat dishes which make me feel sick.

At about nine p.m., I went home by bike on a dark cycle-track; 
because of lack of time I had to take the short-cut.

Once I had to go home on foot at 5 a.m. I had to pass through a 
forest and I was going alone.

I missed the train and had to wait for the next for two hours. 
For this reason I missed an appointment which had been very 
important for me.
When my grandmother died. I had lived with her for ten years.
When I went home by train from Sicilia, I was molested by a man.

A person with whom I had been on bad terms, gave me a present. We 
became reconciled.

A friend's father had died, I was to come and see this friend 
although I did not know his family.

I was watching TV with a friend. After the first film I wanted to 
watch another film on the same channel. My friend switched over 
to the other cannel without asking me what I wanted.
My boy-friend an I seperated on his initiative.

A friend's boy-friend treated her very badly, let her serve him, 
provoked her and just utilized her.

After having considered it for hours I was able to overcome my 
scruples and to call a friend with whom I had fallen in love. I 
realized that my decision was right - and was very glad.

After having slept for a short time I woke up - I had the feeling 
of someone standing beside me and was very frightened. I had to 
turn on the light turn on the light for several minutes before I 
was able to get to sleep again.

I moved to a flat. A friend who had lived there before, had left 
the flat in a terrible mess. I was very angry about that 
sloppiness and impudence.

My father had a complicated operation. A long time before and 
also a long time after that, we did not know how he would get 
over it. During all that time I felt very sad.

It was in a tramway-carriage: A stranger insulted a girl just 
because she blew her nose. I detested his behaviour.
In summer when I was sailing with friends in Greece I felt joy.

I was riding with a friend in his car. At a speed of 120 km/h on 
the snow-covered motorway I would have liked to get out.

Walking along the beach with a friend (another girl), talking, 
picking up shells, laughing, chasing seagulls.

Climbing a mountain to see a view, towards the top we suddenly 
came across a ledge with a nearly sheer drop on either side, 
which I had to cross.

A friend suggested in a round-about way that the reason we were 
late for something was because of me, and that I'm often late. I 
know this was partly true, but felt it unjustified that 
particular time and I felt I couldn't do anything about it 
anyway (i.e. being late).

Talking to a very good friend who had just had a very bad 
experience which was changing his whole way of looking at life 
etc.

I came across a group of people with the same basic ideas/beliefs 
who were all fighting and going against what they would say was 
good.
On meeting an old friend of mine.
When my brother was very late in arriving home from work.
During a fight with my best friend.
When my dog died.

During a movie in which I saw the effect of white settlers in 
Africa.

When I realised that I was forgiven by the God who is there, when 
I realised how much God loves me and that my acceptance with him 
is not based on my performance - that he loves me unconditionally 
and showed that love in Christ who died because I do need 
forgiveness.

Fear - paralysing - that I would not be accepted by the God who I 
believed to be there because I was "morally bankrupt" (before 
becoming a Christian and realising that that was why Christ came to 
free us from sin and to forgive us).

At my father's treatment of my mother, at his disregard for her, 
and not being committed to her.

At a lack of love of my father for my mum, sadness for him more 
than anyone else because he does not realise how much love and 
happiness there could be between them, and is, and how much he is 
damaging himself apart from mum.

At what I was capable of of selfishly using others for sexual 
encounters, while I held a vision of having a deepening 
above-board (you know, "girl next door") devotion to a girl in my 
head. My drives and actions did not match this so consequently I 
felt disgusted at my failure.

I was rock-climbing and absailing & felt OK, but suddenly as I 
was going over the cliff I was hit by fear - I couldn't go on 
absailing down the cliff and had to be actually hauled back up 
it.

I told my boy friend not to park in a certain place because the 
car would ger towed away - he didn't listen and it was towed away. 
At that stage, our finances were below the poverty line & it 
cost us $10.00 - all the money we had to get us through that week 
(including rent).

My sister won a scholarship to Norway and it was particularly as 
she walked across the tarmac to get on the plane and she looked 
back at us.

I work part-time as a shop-assistant and a customer spoke to me 
very loudly about an Indian man & white woman with children - how 
horrible that was and would I want to have little dark children.

I received a wedding invitation from an ex-flatmate, enclosed was 
a small note that overcame a lot of the differences that had 
arisen between us due to the circumstances in which she left the 
flat.

One afternoon, helping at home on the property, I was 
(mustering) getting in cattle and a bull turned and came for me.

Getting a terrible exam mark, which I couldn't understand the 
reason for, and trying to see a lecturer or tutor, but being 
given the runaround.

Watching an old lady running up the street to catch her bus and 
miss it, it reminded me of my own mother and how dreadful it 
would be to be her in the same situation.

Coming home one night - my sister was home, and had been drinking 
heavily and started picking arguments.

When I am travelling by car and have to meet an oncoming car 
while overtaking.
When a close relative is treated badly.
When a close friend died.

When I saw all the starving people in Ethiopia on T.V. It felt 
awful to see such suffering.
When I called my boyfriend he asked me if I would live with him.

Last Summer in Italy I was attacked by a dog.It was terrible to 
feel that untidy dirty dog against my naked skin.

When my father's new fiancee treats me like a child. She does 
not trust me and constantly misunderstands me. I get 
particularly angry when she says nasty things about my boyfriend 
with whom she works.

When the guy I was in love with told me that he had met someone 
else and that we would not meet again for a year. Although we 
did not have a steady relatioship, we were having an affair.
When my love for a guy was returned.

When I think of death - not my own but that of my parents, 
brothers and sisters.

My parents did not approve my choice of a boyfriend (now an 
ex-boyfriend). He happened to be 13 years older than me and he 
was considered completely unsuitable for me. IDIOT.

When my uncle comes (3 times a year) for the traditional 
Christmas dinner with my grandparents and other relatives and is 
very drunk.

I met my present boyfriend on a boat trip to England. We had 
said that we would call each other when we got back to Sweden (we 
were not going to the same town in England). As soon as I walked 
in he called from England as he could not wait till he came 
home.
When my mother's heart nearly stopped.

There was a sofa in my flat which belonged to the old tenants who 
were acquaintances. It should have been picked up a year ago but 
they had postponed it. Eventually they decided on one date and I 
stayed at home despite the fact that I had other things to do. 
They did not come, nor did they call and they still have not got 
in touch with me.
When my ex-boyfriend and I separated.

Very intoxicated men who incite each other to fight. I met a 
vile smelling man on the tram who got closer and closer to me 
till I got up, then he got angry.
When I fell in love.
Earlier, I was afraid of speaking in front of a crowd of people.
A girl I was with went off with another guy.
At set-backs.

I worked in a harbour and emptied latrine containers from the 
back of the lorries.

When I was accepted as a student of Psychology here at 
Gutttenburg.

I woke up in the middle of the night as I had jumped and shouted 
with fear. I thought that someone's cold hand or something 
similar had touched my hand. I crept down under the covers and 
went back to sleep.

When I was a young teenager (14) my brother-in-law to be had 
made heavy advances to me. I did not understand very well what 
it was all about but I reacted strongly and the feelings are 
still there.
I made dinner for some friends and they appreciated it very much.
I was nearly knocked down while I was cycling.

My father and I had an argument because I do not help enough at 
home.

I had intercourse with someone and then I realized that what I 
had done was wrong and it disgusted me.
After intercourse.
Disappointment over a friend.
Quarrelled with my younger brother.
When I woke up after a nightmare.
Helping older people on the toilet.

When I was notified that I had been accepted as a Psychology 
student.

Motor failure on a boat outside Gottenburg when we were in heavy 
seas and the wind was strong. As we could not steer the boat we 
drifted towards the rocks. We did not succeed in attracting the 
attention of any passerby until 4 hours had elapsed.

A lady I live with had not bothered to clean up before she went 
on holiday (I live in a collective).
When I heard that a good friend had committed suicide.

I was present when they found a shop-keeper dead in his shop. 
He had been shot with a shotgun at close range.

After I had made my debut at Ullevi against IFK, Gottenburg and 
got a good write up in the paper.

When I was 7-8 years old, I woke up one night and found myself 
alone at home. My mother had gone out to buy cigarattes from a 
machine.

When I found out that I had failed to pass my exams during the 
term by one point. The fact that exactly the same thing had 
happened last term did not help.

When I was touring Asia with my present football team, I saw old 
Europeans with young asiatic prostitutes.

As an evening class teacher I got positive feedback. When the 
atmosphere is good and a kind of relaxed understanding exists.

After mischieviously ringing on the chemist's trade-entrance 
doorbell and getting caught by him.
The sight of a man who ran amok (fighting) at a dance.
When out of work.

With my mouth full of bun, I drank directly from a packet of milk 
which turned out to be weeks old (completely separated). It took 
a while for the milk to seep through the bun.

When I was accepted as supervisor for a student teacher. The 
notification came by post.

When I was involved in a car accident last November, after the 
first fall of snow. I lost control of the car and it spun round 
and landed on the opposite side of the road, on the hard 
shoulder. It was stopped by a pole on top of a bank sloping down 
to a stream.

With the job appointments committee when the headmaster in charge 
explained that a male teacher was more suitable for the 
particular post. I had more years of service than the male 
teacher, but this was not taken into consideration. I could have 
been given a less attractive job if things had gone the way the 
headmaster wanted.

A colleague's 17 year old daughter is seriously ill with cancer 
and has only a year to live. I heard about it 6 weeks ago.

When a close friend met me at the station in the middle of the 
night, when I came back from a long and tiring journey.
Having quarreled with a boyfriend, he threatened to leave me.

Someone didn't show up at a meeting in spite of having agreed to 
come.

When I understood that my marriage was falling apart, and we 
decided to be legally separated.

At an anti-pornography meeting, when samples from films and 
magazines were shown.
When I was able to buy my new car, after lots of problems.
After my car accident, when I woke up in a heap of stones.

When I tried to put up a tent some years ago, I was teased and 
hindered by my cousin.
When my grandfather died.
When I was admitted to a certain school as a student.

My father has a chronic desease. In the autumn of 1983 he had a 
very strong fit or seizure.

A drunken friend of mine was beating up another friend, who was 
also drunk.

When I didn't get a certain job at Lillehammer which I wanted 
very much.

My boss on the job failed to keep his promise about something he 
knew was extremely important to me.

When my father managed to begin a "new life" after the divorce 
from my mother; resulting in a new little sister for me.
A "near-accident" in a car, driving too fast on an icy road.

My mother and her friends were speaking badly about my father 
when they were separated, and my brothers and sisters and myself 
were allowed to listen.
Being bored in school, not being able to marry and have children.

When my mother's new husband treated her and my brothers and 
sisters badly.

I was in hospital, and then was visited by someone quite 
unexpected.
I was hunting, and was lost in the fog in the mountains.
I was accused of a misdemeanour, unjustly.
When my girlfriend left me.
Slaughtering of animals.

When I finally managed to get a specific sound from my guitar, 
after baving tried for a long time.

Climbing a mountain, I got stuck and realized I could get neither 
up nor down.
Meeting generally dominating persons in social occasions.

Discovering that Lillehammer provided no musical environment that 
suits my taste, even though I had been told so.
Can't describe any disgust situation.
When my children were born.

When I almost ran over a small boy who suddenly was in front of 
my car.

When my father phoned me to come home from my vacation, since he 
no longer had the time to look after my garden and animals.
When I was told that a good friend was seriously ill.

When I learned that a relative had been spreading rumours about 
me.
When my special friend said "I love you" for the first time.

After having watched a crime show on the TV, I was about to take 
the dog for a walk. Then, suddenly, there was a man on the 
porch... (We live some distance away from other people).
When my car suddenly broke down !
When an earlier friend was spreading negative rumours about me.

There is a certain person, whom I only have seen. He makes me 
cringe, feel disgust.
When my term paper was evaluated.

After seeing a terror movie at the cinema, I was so scared that I 
couldn't even drive the car into the garage. I often thought 
about the film afterwards, hoping such things couldn't exist in 
the "real world".
Angry with my brother, who was making fun of me, teasing me.
When my gradmother died.
Got in touch with earlier friends after a long absence.
I lost my way on a trip in the mountains.

Being subject to unfair treatment in a working group, someone 
"bending the rules" was protected by the boss. This resulted in 
more work for the others.
The death of a close friend.

Was confronted with a person having negative thoughts of other 
people because of their social status, beliefs, color and 
outlook on life (perspective).

Receiving a much wanted letter from a very good friend who lives 
abroad.

Before getting back the results of a test in school, when I had 
worked very hard and was worried about not succeeding.

One of my best friends accused me of giving up to early on 
problems. It was only a casual remark on her side, but I was 
angry and hurt.

Realizing that school will soon be over, and we will all go 
different ways, perhaps never meeting again our friends from this 
year.

In a public swimming hall I saw a very aggressive man who 
practically attacked the children who got in his way when he was 
swimming.
A friend which I hadn't seen for years, sent me a small present.

One dark night with no street lights, a car was obviously 
following me.
I was subject to false accusations, and got very angry.

I was told by a good friend that we couldn't be friends any more 
because of his relationship with another girl.

This is difficult, since I don't remember feeling disgust towards 
anyone.

When my fiancee travelled 2000 Km to visit me, and I hadn't seen 
her for 4 months.

I was beaten up at a private New Year's party once, through no 
fault of mine.

I felt unfairly treated at an airport, being told to use a 
different counter (for domestic traffic only).
When my grandmother died.

The murder of two girls on a school trip to Berlin (and sexual 
crimes generally) a couple of years ago.
When the person that I was very fond of, returned to me.
Not applicable to myself.

When students in our working group showed no responsibility or 
interest in our work.
A very close friend left me.

Some people were unfairly treated, because of their 
nationality/colour.

A close acquaintace cried for me. I felt happy because somebody 
cared.

A letter from my boyfriend began in such a way that I thought he 
was going to end our relationship. I was afraid of reading the 
rest.

My nephew is a deaf and also "hyperactive" boy. I had been 
responsible for looking after him for a full day, and was very 
tired. Then he suddenly grabbed a knife and stabbed me in the 
leg. I got so angry that I didn't feel any pain.

A woman I know is slowly dying from cancer. Observing this 
process makes me sad.
Close friends talking badly of other friends.
Renewed contact with an earlier friend.

Fearing the use of power or reprimands when I belong to the 
minority.

A close friend first said he accepted an agreement, but later 
used that agreement as a reason for attacking me.

When realizing that my girlfriend and myself in fact had started 
the process of breaking up.

Political and military trnsgressions around the world, generally 
speaking. This cannot be described through this questionaire.

Receiving a postcard form my sweetheart who was abroad on 
vacation, not being at all sure if he would write me or not.

When I tried to breake it up with my boyfriend, and he refused to 
let me go.

Having to go back home form the U.S. after having been there for 
ten weeks to visit my brother and his family.
Finding my glasses again after having lost them in town.
Falling off a cliff in the mountains.
Having a fight with a class mate.
When the gear broke on my car.
Can't remember having had this feeling.
I got a job right after school was over.

Going home alone through the forest after a girl guide (scout ?) 
meeting.
I get angry when people disbelieve me or misunderstand me.
At the death of a close relative.

Having been unjustly punished, I feel disgust towards the person 
responsible.

Having passed the exam required to be an authorized Radio/TV 
dealer.

Climbing a mountain where the rocks were very loose. When we 
realized the danger, we were very high up, but still had a long 
climb ahead.

Being a spokesman for the union, I got into a quarrel with a 
colleague who had been acting disloyally over a sustained period 
of time.

When my grandfather died, with whom I had a very close 
relationship.

Reading about executions and massacres which happened during 
World War II, I felt disgust towards those who did it.
Succeeding in helping others.

When I realized that we are living on borrowed time, and that the 
nuclear holocaust appears to come closer every day.
When others let me down, fail to keep agreements.
Death in the close family.

When people manipulate others through appearing better than what 
they really are.

I received the message that I'd been accepted at the school where I 
really wanted to go.

I came home and discovered that someone had broken in. Then I 
realized that they probably were still there.

I was accused of having drunk a bottle of liquor and then 
refilling with water.

Got a package from my parents, without even a small note 
enclosed.
Quarreling with my father, when he made false assertions.
Winning the local soccer championships this year was a great joy.
Before important sports events.
When colliding with my car. I myself was to blame.

Not succeeding in a cross-country skiing competition, which I 
intended to win.
Can't remember any episode of disgust.
Getting the top price in the football pools.

Was threatened with a knife ... in the military by soldiers form 
another unit. The reason was girls.
When my mother treats me as a 10-year old boy.
Getting to know that my uncle in America had a brain tumor.

Outside a night club, a grown man was sitting on top of a younger 
woman, beating her up.

Receiving close friends form abroad, whom I hadn't seen for 
years.

Motorcycle accident with two people involved, running off the 
road. Broke an arm, only.

Having agreed to share the taxi expenses, three people in the 
back of the car just ran off, leaving the person up front with 
the entire bill.
Death of a close friend.
Can't remember any such feelings now.
Selling my used car.

Almost crashing my car, something which could have led to great 
problems.

Realizing that a friend had been talked into signing a certain 
contract.
Talking to a pensioned and bitter "street order" policeman.
The sadistinc exacution of a student in the USA.
Managed to run 30 Km on skis fairly simply.

Afraid I wouldn't catch the train when I was going to see my 
sweetheart.
Receiving personal criticisms early in the morning.
Not getting a job.
Seeing a pornographic film when looking for a place to live.
Reunion with my wife after a legal separation.

The house was on fire, and I was saved by the dog. I am afraid of 
the fire, verging on panic.

Physical violence. A friend wouldn't listen to me I repeatedly 
tried to warn him, to no avail. Result: eight people were "pissed 
off".
My father dying.
Maltreatment of children.
Relating to my closest family.

Thinking of the unknown, what happens at the moment of death, 
etc.

In traffic I often get relatively angry with other drivers. 
Several transgressions make me mad, especially not yielding to 
priority traffic (e.g. coming from the right).

Losing close people and animals. So far, I've felt most when 
losing our dog in a traffic accident.

I feel disgust towards those who are responsible for the death of 
others.
When the contract about my shop was signed.

Being very close to having an auto accident, almost driving off 
the road.
Having gone to school without learning anything, as usual.
My sweatheart were away on a trip, and then she got problems.
Overeating a traditional type of food - blood pudding.

Receiving a letter form a girl that means a lot to me 
emotionally.
Being close to drowning.
Being slandered by friends.
Love problems.
Does not apply.
I won the country ski championship.
I was scared in the dark when I was a little boy.

Angry when our team (small boys) lost the county championship 
football final.
My grandfather's death.

A teacher gave me lower grades than I was entitled to, and was 
hoping for.

When the bank let me borrow some money this winter, after my 
grant was spent.

Once I was stopped by the police in Spain, when I had some 
"grass" in my tobacco.

My father accused my brother of having bumped his car, and it was 
wrong.
When a girlfriend left me.

When a "friend" dropped a frog down my neck, and I didn't know 
what it was.

I am a school teacher. At a teacher-parent meeting I received a 
good deal of positive feed-back on my work both from the parents 
and through them from the pupils.

As a child, when I was at home alone, I felt in an indefinate 
manner afraid of the death of my father and mother.

I had a discussion with my mother concerning my sister's divorce, 
we disagreed strongly.

As a ten-year-old I was at the funeral of my grand-father. It was more 
the ceremonies held in the church and not really the death of my 
grand-father which made me sad.

I had a discussion with my wife about an over-weight acquaintance of 
our's, about her eating habits and the scars caused by her 
pregnancy.
[ A successful lesson.]
[ I was thinking about death.]
A conflict with a pupil.
When I am at home alone.
A saturday night a bus full of drunken people.
When in an economic crisis I got an unexpected sum of money.
In the dark an unreal figure formed by a shadow.
[ When I was treated unfairly, regardless of my motives or deeds.]

When I noticed obvious marks of old age (in a negative sense) on 
a close relative of mine.
As a child, when I saw an "unesthetic" sight.

I was coming home from an exam and I supposed that I had 
passed it so I ran to a restaurant for a beer.

I had been drinking with a pal and I later (1 o' clock) had a date 
with my fiancee. We were going to a Spanish lesson and I was 
afraid that she would smell that I had been drinking.

My fiancee and I were at my parent's place watching TV. There 
were only two TV-chairs and we were sitting on them when my 
drunken brother came in and rudely chased my fiancee off the 
chair she was sitting on.
I had drunk a couple of beers and my fiancee got angry at me.

We were at a hamburger bar and a man at a table nearby started 
coughing and spitting into his plate.
While dancing in a restaurant last week.

I was on the Inter Rail in Naples alone. After an evening in a 
restaurant I was going back to the hotel when a prostitute 
approached me to sell herself. I refused but as I carried on 
walking I felt that I was being followed by someone.
When a girl left me.

I was on my way back from the Inter Rail, on board the ferry from 
Stockholm when my father called me at 7 o'clock to tell me that my 
uncle had died and that I would be seeing him off on his final 
journey within four days.

On Reperbahn, in a restaurant, a "charming" old saleswoman came 
to beg a drink for herself.

My girlfriend gave me some feed-back and I understood that it 
meant that our relationship was about to turn even closer.
At the dentist's, waiting for my turn to come.

While in the army, I was treated unfairly by my superiors. I was 
held responsible for a deed of which I was innocent.

When I came to know that my grandmother had died. She was very 
close to me.

In the army, an acquaintance of mine tended to use his position 
to advance his own interests.

When I look at people around and know that people who are stupid 
look stupid.

When I saw Russian roulette on TV. (obviously the movie "Deer 
hunter")
When stupid people push me during rush time in the city.
[ Laziness makes one sad.]

When I saw hundreds of snakes twisting over one another in a 
movie.
[ Being close to another person.]
[ Uncertainty about my own abilities in an exam.]
[ An unfair punishment.]
Loneliness, being uncertain of myself in the Autumn.
A rich man expressing disgust towards an alcoholic.

I went to a doctor with a complaint. The doctor told me that I 
was completely healthy.

My father was away from home and he did not come back when he was 
expected, he came back several hours later than expected.

I had an implicit agreement with my sister about meeting her, 
however she had not understood the situation the same way so she 
did not turn up.
I realized that the girl I loved had to leave me.

In the bus I was sitting next to a colleage who was drunk and 
behaved in keeping with his state.

When I unexpectedly received birthday greetings from a person I 
like.

I returned home late from a party last night and I felt afraid 
trying to anticipate the reaction of my father.
When I learned that my brother had spoilt an LP of mine.

When I came to know that a girl I was fond of already had a 
boyfriend.
A too eager approach by a dirty drunken person in a bus.
I shot the decisive goal in an ice-hockey match.

When I got lost in New York city a late friday night with a 
friend of mine.
After having quarelled with a relative of mine about politics.
The death of my grandmother.

When I noticed that a nice person was being exploited 
economically.

I passed an exam which I was not sure at all to pass. I rejoyced 
at the result because the possibility of continuing my studies 
depended on it.

In the traffic with a car, I nearly got crushed between a bus and 
a tram. The attention of other drivers saved me at the last moment.

I was disappointed and angry at the bad quality of a documentay 
program on TV. In my opinion, the topic was important and the 
program should have been made with seriousness and consideration.

My father had a heart attack when I was not at home (I was still 
living with them). He recovered relatively well although he had 
to retire (which implied relief from the stress of a small scale 
enterprise).

At my grandmother's detestable and selfish conduct towards my 
elder sister, although her behavior was due to senility and lack of 
understanding.

On the cliff by the sea, the silence and the sudden voice of a 
bird.(swans of the bay)
A dark night when I had to go to the outdoor lavatory.

When I realized that I was far behind the others in the language 
course and I could no longer catch up with the others.

The long lasting illness of my grand-mother, and the changes in 
family relationships caused by it.

Spoilt, smashed and molded potatoes in the fridge, and having to 
clean up the dish later.

When I got home from my job, I found a letter from the university 
telling me that I had been admitted to begin my studies.

While watching TV (a war movie), I felt a strong fear of death, 
threat and fear of loosing people close to me.

I was angry with a friend of mine who behaved in an affected 
manner.

I made a long-distance call to people rather close to me and I 
thought about the sad incident that had happened to them in the 
near past; I knew that they were thinking about it too when I made 
the call.

My parents inherited an appartment and this made them behave in a 
peculiar manner.

I unexpectedly met a girl with whom I have always got along well. 
( I had not seen her for several months.)
When my father was very drunk and raging at home.

When I did not find the rack used for beating up rugs, in the 
yard.
When one of my cat died of a disease.

I felt disgusted at the environment while getting back to my 
student lodging. I did not see anything in the suburb which had 
been planned by taking people's comfort into account.

In Sweden, a friend and I lived in an appartment owned by a Finn. 
One day, this man came back to the appartment heavily drunk 
(hashish and alcohol). He was quite dizzy and he broke down, and 
I could not foretell his reactions. However, nothing happened.

I had an appointment downtown, and the person in question was 
half an hour late.
The death of my grandmother.

In the army, I had been in hospital for two weeks and as soon as 
I returned to the company, a sergeant ordered me to fetch a load 
on the tractor trailer.
I got a fairly large amount of my taxes back.

I was jogging in the forest, in the central park area, when I saw 
a man hiding behind a tree. I got frigthened, turned around and 
ran out of the forest.

I was coming home in a taxi with a fellow worker of mine. He was 
criticizing my earlier conduct towards him, which to my mind was 
unfounded. When I reached home, I ran out of the taxi and 
slammed the door.

I had had a farewell party at the place where I had been working 
for a year. That night I could not fall off to sleep. I was sad 
thinking that I would not see my nice fellow workers again.

I was travelling in a local train when a drunkard, smelling 
terribly, entered the same carriage and started eating fish that 
was stinking.
A sunny Autumn day, after a long rainy period.

Years ago, on my way to school by the forest path I came across 
an exhibitionist.

A person close to me mistook my good intentions for bad, and 
therefore associated unpleasant traits to me.

[ A person close to me told me that his positive regard depended 
on my conduct.]

When an untidy and heavyly drunk person made endeavours to 
approach me.
I got to know that I had been accepted at university.

I had been watching a TV-program on paranormal phenomena. At 
night I could not fall off to sleep as I feared that humanoids 
were on the move.

My superior blamed me for some neglects at work in front of 
others. In fact, the task in question was not supposed to be 
done by me.
My father suddenly fell ill and died.

When a friend of mine got drunk and started to blame and scorn my 
other friends and me.

My joy was the joy of meeting again. My husband came home after 
having been away for weeks (for work). I was on the railway 
station to meet him.

I was alone at home and I could hear odd noises coming from above 
our bedroom. I knew that nobody lived there since it was an 
office. I got frightened (later I was given a "natural" 
explanation).

A relative of mine had come to see my husband to talk to him 
about a problem concerning his sister and me. I was angry 
because this relative of mine did not dare to speak to me and 
instead spoke to my husband. I got to know about it later the 
same day.

The death of my father, even though we had not been very close to 
each other.

The male friend of my mother (a widow) moved in to live with us. 
I did not like the man.

My mother, sister and I were thinking about old times, our 
childhood, and we had a very happy time.

My husband had gone to drive a strange, broken car. At the 
agreed time, he had not returned, and I feared that he had had an 
accident.

I am a school teacher. One of the classes does not obey me at all, 
keeps on talking, does no work. One afternoon, everything went 
wrong, and I got exceedingly angry.

A young, close relative of mine died, leaving behind a baby a few 
months old.

A series about Freud was shown on TV. In it, a tampon had been 
set in the nose of a woman, and forgotten there. After great 
pain it was taken off (close-up picture), the woman was bleeding 
from the nose and the mouth.

I started a new branch of studies after having failed a former 
one. When I got back my exam papers I was very happy to know 
that I almost had full marks.

I was diving below the ice, in a cave, at a depth of 26 metres. 
Visibility was almost zero and the oxygen level decreased 
threateningly. There were three of us divers on one safety rope.

My mother carried on using mental pressure concerning something 
which was serious and a real burden to me.
My grandfather died, I went to the mortuary and saw the corpse.
[ The same as in anger.]
My girlfriend sent me a letter with a shiny picture in it.

I was about to begin a journey in a car with an acquaintance of 
mine.

On the TV news I heard that Nicaragua had complained about the 
increasing threat of war with the USA.
My girlfriend gave me the mitten (left me).
Watching a violent movie.

When, to my surprise, I got to know about having got "very good" 
high school graduation marks.

My grandmother was about to die, and it had the effect that at 
night, after having read a book, and once in bed, in perfect 
darkness, the fear arose that I too may suddenly die.

When I checked my examination paper and realized that I had been 
careless, thoughtless, lazy and hasty so as to make unnecessary 
mistakes concerning things I know and understand.

When we decided, my boyfriend and I, that we would separate, I 
realized that he would have wanted to continue our relationship 
and the coming separation hurt him.

When an acquaintance of mine told me about the way his parents 
treated their sons in an unequal manner. The most successful of 
them got continuous encouragement, and the youngest was not 
encouraged and was rejected.

I am not especially good at English, and after the high school 
graduation exam in English I tensely waited for the result the 
whole day. In the evening, when I heard that I had done 
excellently, I became very happy and the anxiety vanished. My 
family was at home.

I feared that I was pregnant. It was not planned and I would 
have been compelled to have an abortion, which I would not have 
liked at all. Fortunately, after a week's anxiety, I got to know 
that I was not pregnant.

A member of a religious sect tried to convert me, using really 
evil tricks to persuade me. After he had left, I was anxious and 
angry for a long time. After the event, I was alone.
When my boyfriend wanted to leave me, I felt sad and melancholic.

In a film, there was an episode where they used a chain saw to 
cut a man. I could not look at it, but I could not avoid 
listening either. I sought shelter in my boyfriend's arms.

When I got an unexpected letter from a guy, who had been my school 
mate.

When my brother went to shoot wild ducks, I feared that the 
boat would overturn and he would drown or that the gun would 
accidentally go off.

My father had once again told me that I should be careful and try to 
seek admission to other places also apart from the faculty of 
Social Sciences at the university of Helsinki. I was not at all 
interested in any other place and had no time to study for other 
entrance exams.

I would have liked to go out to chat with some acquaintances, but 
I realized that I was not wanted. I felt hurt, disappointed, 
lonely and deserted.

When an acquaintance (he was drunk) of my room-mate vomitted on the kitchen 
carpet. It was past mid-night and my room-mate had just moved in, 
this acquaintance had helped her move in.

When I got 21/30 points in an exam of statistics. The result was 
unexpected and it made me realize that statistics do not 
surpass my abilities, as I have sometimes thought.

When a big angry dog put its snout on my arm and had I made one 
movement it would have bitten me.

When my room-mates were watching video-tapes and prevented me 
from watching the news. The first feeling I had was that I was 
being treated unfairly and then came the feeling of anger.

[ When after a night of sleeping in another's arms, one wakes 
alone and knows that the lonely arms of the night are not the 
same that one meets in the morning.]

When an unpleasant person tried to make friends with me. A 
subtle, small, insignificant, grey being whose helplessness and 
neutrality evoked the feeling of disgust in me.

When my friend told me that he would come and meet me in a 
moment.

My father had been drinking and I feared him when we went to bed 
at night.

My friends promised me that they would definitely call me to tell 
me if they were visiting me or not.
A close friend of mine had not contacted me for a long time.
A friend of mine came to see me when he was quite drunk.

When I felt that an exam, which I had feared, was an easy one and 
went well.

I was afraid when my dog ran out through a crack in the fence 
when a train was coming.

When a friend of mine was drawn into a fight because of the 
stupid gang he belonged to. I felt angry with him and his 
friends. They could not think about anything sensible, but would 
fool around without taking into consideration the feelings of 
other persons.

I felt sad after having had an argument with my boyfriend. I felt 
that he did not understand me and that there was no point in 
carrying on with the relationship.

I detested my father who was a drunkard. He would rave, 
threaten and blame my mother and me. He finally drove us away 
from home.

When I got home from a pleasant trip abroad, I got to know that I 
had been accepted at university.

At school, I had acted against the will of the group, and the 
next day they promised to take revenge on me.

My mother had for some time been trying to separate me from a 
good friend who, she thought, was not good company for me. 
Finally, at breakfast one day, we had an argument and I tried to 
defend my friend.
I got to know about the death of a close friend.

When I was watching a movie with many violent episodes. They 
accurately showed the cutting of corpses, etc...

When I was pressing figures on the curtain cloth. I had bought 
the cloth after months of hindrances.

I am a kindergarten teacher and I am thoroughly weary of my job. 
After having taken the university entrance exam I suffered from 
anxiety for weeks as I did not want to carry on with my work - studies 
were the only alternative.

My life-partner, who was drinking more and more, spoke about 
kicking the cat. He had never done anything of the kind, but I 
knew that he would do so one day, without thinking about it.

Estrangement from my best woman friend. We have been going 
different ways for quite some time now, but the break was total 
when she got married as her husband is unreasonably jealous of me.

My life-partner is going through a crisis (way of life, old-fashioned values) 
and can only get out of it by talking bold decisions. I have 
noticed his cowardice and attempts to escape his problems by 
drinking. I detest his drinking and his being full of self-pity.

Begining the week-end with my girlfriend : cozyness, beer and 
wine.

The fear about my future : work, making ends meet and health. 
Coping.

A friend of mine ridiculed me, telling me that I would never 
accomplish anything. I felt that he had interfered with my life.

I felt sad at having to leave my girlfriend after constant problems 
and failed attempts at reconciliation. My sadness was caused by 
the irreversibility of the decision.
A man spat on the wall of a house.

When after an overwhelming anxiety and enquiry, I understood 
something about why I exist and what my task in life is.

At the railway station, while waiting for the last train at night 
I noticed that a drunk young man was appraching me in a 
purposeful mannner.

While having a discussion with my mother, I realized that she 
does not for a moment doubt the justification of her making the 
decisions concerning my life.

When I think that I will probably never have a genuine contact 
with my parents.

While reading Olli Jalonen's new book, the distant, cold and 
selfish relationships between people (in the book) made me feel 
disgusted.

The day I got to know that I would get a shared dwelling with my 
boyfriend. My parents place was getting a little crowded with 
my growing bother wanting a room to himself. I first felt doubt, 
then joy, but also sadness. The feeling of joy was the 
strongest.

My grandfather had lung-cancer and was being nursed at 
home. I felt fear when I was alone with him and he almost choked 
on mucus secretions.

The outrageous conduct of a relative towards me and those close 
to me.(blaming us and lying)
We had to finish the life of our 8 year-old dog.
A very drunk person.
[ A chat on the telephone with a friend.]

[ Meeting some new (unpleasant) people or some new, demanding 
situation.]
[ For example, unfair pushing in a bus.]
