Was picking up my father from work and on passing through the 
Valley watched three prostitutes walk up and down waiting for 
someone to pick them up. Clothing was disgusting.

When I won the "Under 18" Showjumping at the Brookfield Show. The 
competition was very stiff and there were many riders competing.

When I was on holiday, walking back to where I was staying, at 
night, and two men started closely following me. There was nobody 
around that I could run to.

When my mother and father split up I was angry: I felt deprived 
and "different" from other children at school.

I was terribly upset when my kitten got hit by a car. He didn't 
die, but for several weeks we thought he might have to be put 
down.

When I heard that one of my good friends, when at a party, had 
got herself involved with some very undesirable characters and 
was experimenting with drugs.
Day I received my T.E. score and acceptance into my chosen course.
First day at University (I didn't know what to expect).

At a school dance when my supposed "best friend" kept walking 
away from me whenever I came near her.

At end of school - function to "celebrate" ? Leaving friends who 
I'd known for up to 12 years.

While watching a film of an experimental operation on a cat's 
brain in which the cat had metal pieces protruding from its eyes, 
mouth etc. to keep the head stable while being cut open.

Eating biscuits and drinking Milo (Chocolate energy drink made 
with milk and usually drunk warm) with my friend at College. We 
get on really well, don't withold any feelings about each other's 
friends and are pretty good at cheering each other up when we are 
homesick.

Going to a disco by myself to wait for some friends. We had 
separated and hadn't planned where to meet. I wasn't sure if they 
were even going to this place so I felt very conscious of being 
alone.

A person ignored my advice, did not pay any attention to what was 
saying. She acted as though I wasn't even there. We were doing 
group work so everybody had the right to speak yet she just 
ignored me. She made me feel insignificant.

A friend of mine is having psychiatric problems because of his 
mother's death ages ago. He is really quiet and because it 
relates back to his childhood I feel sadness for him. He doesn't 
lead a normal life and it just seems unfair.

At school, when the only thing people my age could think of was getting 
rolling drunk. They couldn't have a good time without firstly 
getting drunk.

Getting a good mark for a subject I had worked hard at but 
expected only a moderate mark.

When cleaning up a pile of junk under our house, a huge spider (a 
"Jungle Spider") ran out near me. (I do not like even small 
spiders).

At the hardware store, trying to convert Imperial to Metric 
measurements, I made a mistake, and didn't buy enough tiles for 
the bathroom. I was angry at myself, because I hope to be a Maths 
teacher.
My father died last year after an 8-week severe illness.

During the PY 102 film session on Tuesday, one of the films shown 
was of an experiment on a live cat involving strapping it into a 
machine for possibly days, and doing things to its brain.

I got a good reaction from my tutor and tutorial group for a 
presentation I'd given that I was very worried about.

A man was yelling outside my window at 3.00 am, yelling threats, 
though not to me.

Going away for the weekend, leaving my College room open - when I 
returned several friends had had a party there, leaving the mess.
Passing away of my father.

At a party where the boys were telling revolting stories about 
the girls they'd been with.

When I received the results from my final examination - Higher 
School Certificate - and received a mark that was beyond my 
wildest expectations.

Walking around the University at night by myself, having been 
previously warned of rapes, etc.

When I received the mark well above requirements for the course I 
wanted to enter, yet I was not accepted - anger at the injustice 
of it, because I didn't receive early release of H.S.C. marks.

When I left all my friends at school (break up) knowing we would 
probably all go our separate ways, and none see one another for a 
long time.

At my father, when he yelled and accused my sister's friend (over 
the phone) of doing something he didn't do, or know anything 
about.
Got through first semester University.

At the tender age of eleven a friend and I left a party and 
proceeded to walk through dark and secluded streets of a bad 
neighborhood to find a telephone (recent spate of Horror Movie 
watching had occurred).

In a situation whereby a friend's actions were deliberately 
against my wishes and (with) no regard to my feelings.

I broke up with my boyfriend of seven months, but it was a very 
"indepth" relationship and so after feelings of grief and loss 
were over I felt an immense sadness.

A situation where I ignored my beliefs and principles for a trip 
of whimsy.
Getting back with my boyfriend after a year away - apart.
Having my luggage checked at Customs.
When a friend wouldn't speak to me and wouldn't tell me why.
Thinking about friends overseas.
Hearing of a filthy situation over the phone.

When I opened my TE Score envelope, and saw I got into 
Physiotherapy.
When I was bringing in the shopping and nearly stood on a snake.
When I was accused of "bitching" about best friend.

At our Senior dinner - separated from school friends, nothing 
will ever be the same again.
At a night club watching little tarts trying to earn a living.

When my brothers had passed all of their exams and were able to 
graduate from their courses.
When I was caught in an elevator and it got stuck between floors.
When I was put into a tennis team below my standard.
When my father died.

When I have seen people very drunk and making fools of 
themselves.

When my present boyfriend asked me initially to go out with him I 
had waited a long time for this to occur.

When somebody broke into our home one night when my mother was 
out, and my sister and I had just gone to bed.

When my sister lost my favourite jumper at a party and failed to 
tell me for several days after it happened.

When my father passed away of cancer, I was extremely saddened. 
He was not very old, which made matters worse. The actual death 
was horrendous, but the moving funeral saddened me more so.

When walking along the beach with my boyfriend, we saw 2 people 
having sex on the sand dunes in full view of everyone. It was the 
fact that they chose that area in which to have sex, that 
disgusted me.

I stayed at the Coast for a weekend with friends. My brother came 
to drive me home, but was rude, and in a hurry to rejoin his 
friends. I was embarrassed because the family involved was 
extremely nice, and hospitable to him.

When I saw my brother in Church, and publically accept Jesus 
Christ as his saviour and Lord.

I was seven years old and swimming outside the flags at the Gold 
Coast. I was caught in a rip and taken out about 100 m. I 
couldn't swim too well, but an older friend (17) swam out and 
saved me.

While at school I had to write an essay for doing something wrong 
that I didn't do. I wrote the essay about how I was mistreated and 
got Saturday morning detention along with a few other kids, but 
they didn't show up.
When one of my closest friends died unexpectantly.

When I saw a male engineer one year and came back to find he was 
now a female (I don't know it/them personally).

On holidays - just driving along a road beautiful scenery. Just 
with my boyfriend - not really talking but just feeling 
overwhelmed.
Good news about a sick relative.
Walking in the dark by myself.
Getting terrible meals, but paying heaps for them.
When felt lonely about writing my family.
Person talking about a situation while eating.

When I received my TE Score and my acceptance from University - 
it had been a goal since I left the bank a year earlier.
Every time I see a spider or a snake.

My younger brother and I had been fighting over the TV/Video. He 
kept on turning it on and off every 2 seconds and was not 
listening to my authority and was being cheeky. We fought and I 
ended up in tears - he'd won.
The first time I left home.

On a camp - boys and girls in one cabin. One guy forced himself 
upon another girl and was having intercourse, while the girl in 
the bunk beneath was pretending to be asleep and not be ill.

Can't remember specific event - besides just being moderately 
happy until a year or so ago.
Left alone in dark when young.
Can't remember exact example.
Close relative is dying of cancer - found out last week.

Doctors ignored relative who complained about pain, and is now 
dying of cancer.
After the fact that made me ashamed I felt sadness.

A person that eat half of a cockroach in a cake without knowing 
it.

When finally I found a place to live, I felt relieved, predicting 
changes in my life, and I became happy.
When I dreamed that I was being attacked by a friend.
When I was left by the person I loved without any reason.
To fight with a sister and to know that she doesn't care.
To be kissed by soembody I didn't expect to.

I felt it when I received a letter telling that I had been 
classified in a national concourse of p... I felt happy and 
vanity about it.

I felt fear when once I was asleep and dreamed that I was dying 
asfixiated by a cardiac attack, I was afraid and woke up 
desperate. Altough I wasn't afraid of death I was afraid.

I feel it when I see that somebody is traying to made a stupid of 
me.

I felt it when I was at home and saw a discussion without sense 
between my parents.

When I see all the putridness of people. The fact is the catarrh 
and spits that whash the streets of S.Paulo.
When I asked my girlfriend to marry me.

When I almost drowned myself in the municipal swimming pool that 
I use to go almost not excaping.

I was with my girlfriend when some guys that I don't like made 
fuss at my girl.
The death of my grandfather.

To go through the underground way at suburb station of LAPA. Poor 
people and the ambulants badly dressed up in a passage badly 
kept.
When I met a friend that I hadn't seen for some time.
When I got in jungle where there was a great number of snakes.
When an unknown person provoked me verbaly and physically.
When my team lost a championship.
A dirty person, smelling bad and unknown laying on me.

When I began to date a boy with whom I am till now. This was 16 
months ago.
I learned that my girlfriend had been unjustly missed from work.
I got separated from the man I loved.

An acquaintance of mine revealed himself in a light unexpected to 
me.

When I took my entrance exams successfully and also when I got my 
school leaving certificate because the delivering ceremony was 
extremely official.

When I was to sit for my first entrance exam. I had fear of a 
possible failure.

I was indignant at the unimpartiality shown by the referees at 
the football match between Bulgaria and France.
When I got separated from the man I loved so much.

When I was watching some scenes from the Bertoluchi's film 
"Twentieth Century".
When I was admitted to the Sofia University.
When I come home late at night.
When I talk to silly, petty-minded and unmanageable people.
When my friend (girl) went abroad for two years.
When I happen to witness some sadistic acts.
I was admitted to the University and a niece was born to me.
I was bitten by a dog.
My grandfather's funeral.
I was alone at home on New Year's Eve.
I was on a walk with my child when I met a drunk woman.
My admittance to the University.
A grenade blew out next to me.
An unjust calumny concerning me.
Unrealisation of the desired profession (aviator).
Disgust with a subordinate.
Winning Queensland Chess Championship.

When in a car accident where car was total wipe off (wipe out, or 
write off).
With self at losing an important game that I should have won.
Death of grandfather (unexpected).

Someone smoking on Electric train (Electric trains are 
non-smoking) with alcohol smell coming from person.

Receiving a very personal letter from a lady that I like, which 
revealed that she was more enthusiastic about me than I had 
thought possible.
Introducing myself at a first tutorial this year at University.

I was angry at a University tutorial when an ignorant loudmouth 
persisted in trying to dominate the conversation.

I left my home in Melbourne to come to Q'land to study and before 
I hopped in the car I hugged my mother and shook hands with my 
father. Sensing immediately my father's sadness, I also had a 
flood of the same emotion.
When one of my parents verbally, personally abused the other.
Being in love for the first time.

As a child - stepping on a rusty nail - being told that I might 
get tetanus.

As a child - about 8 years old - walking across a paddock - being 
set upon by another boy who claimed it was "his land" - being 
intimidated by the boy - crying, being punched, etc.
As a child - having a dog - it getting a disease and dying.

Being in a Malaysian city with my girlfriend coming out of a 
picture theatre - seeing her rush up to a taxi that a very old 
sick man was trying to get to. Seeing her take over the taxi.

When I achieved my first 6 at University after a long string of 
3's, 4's and 5's (7 is the highest mark awarded, 3 is a conceded 
pass).

One night going downstairs, and hearing a strong stirring of 
brances, which was not the wind.

I was informed by my flatmate that, when we'd moved into our 
flat, she'd expected us to buy our food separetely - this event 
actually happened some 5 months after our sharing began. Prior to 
this, she had said nothing.

Having to decide on a termination of a pregnancy, after 
discussing it with friends, family and the man involved.

When a friend didn't invite her own parents to her Graduation 
ceremony.

When I was a child, my beloved cat gave birth to four beautiful 
little kittens. Before she had them, she came up to me and I 
followed her out, then witnessed them being born.

On embarking on University life. I came from a different city and 
did not know anybody at the Uni. I was frightened because my well 
known and loved friends, also all my security had been taken 
away.

When my brothers were being cruel to my boyfriend, because his 
flat-mate bent back one of my brother's fingers. It wasn't his 
fault.

Upon moving away from home for the first time to a different 
city, I felt no longer "under the wing" of my parents even though 
they would always be there to help me. I felt a sense of loss, I 
was now all alone in the world, responsible for my own actions.

I was sitting at a rock concert, listening to an extremely loud 
band. A tiny baby in a crawler had been left by his young mother, 
right out in the sun next to a speaker, and was screaming - 
probably in pain.

The weekend after I argued with my parents I went home again and 
they couldn't have been nicer. As soon as I walked in, Mum kissed 
me, then Dad, and thanked me for the birthday presents I'd left 
for him, including a very sentimental birthday card.

Before Uni started, I had to leave home and take up residence in 
Brisbane (the "big smoke") leaving home, my family, and moving to 
such a big place was quite intimidating at first, and I was 
anxious about it.

My flatmate was asking questions about my relationship with my 
boyfriend, whether I wasn't treating him as unfairly as I claimed 
he'd been treating me. As a result, I was angered, and became 
defensive.

A very close friend from Victoria visited me over the holidays. 
Having enjoyed his company immensely over 10 short days, I was 
overwhelmed by sadness when he left to return to Victoria.

One of my flatmates and I came back to the flat Monday morning, 
to find a real Mess, left by the guy we share with.

Joy of giving birth, and of sharing that joy with my husband. 
Moments of complete happiness and feelings of so much love.

Attempted rape by 5 guys - held my arms behind my back and 
molested me, constantly threatening to beat me. Penetration did 
not occur as the driver of the car stopped that.

Anger at doctors for their treatment of me after giving birth. 
They left part of placenta behind and I bled heavily for twelve 
weeks - due to this, I felt weak and emotional, and they said I 
needed psychiatric treatment and give me no support.

When my son was diagnosed as having CEREBRAL PALSY, at age 5. He 
would have to endure so much labelling, stigma and discrimination, 
even though his case was relatively mild.

I have an adopted Aboriginal sister I felt disgust due to the 
racism she has been subjected to.

Receiving notification that I had made a successful application 
to the Speech Therapy course at Uni, gave me a very good feelig 
of achievment and joy.
Not included on questionnaire.

My ex-boyfriend began to date my best friend. After they had been 
seeing each other, I found out that he had been sleeping with 
another girl, without my friend knowing, I told my friend what he 
had been doing behind her back.

My mother left my father for his best friend, and he moved to 
Papua New Guinea. Despite the fact that I am closer to my father 
than to anyone else in my family, I had to move in with my 
mother, and say good-bye to my father, not knowing when I would 
see him again.

When I discovered my mother had been having an affair with my 
father's best friend, and then ran away with him without even 
speaking to me about what she was doing letting me come home from 
school simply to find her gone. I was filled with disgust and 
contempt.

Seeing a close friend who had just returned from twelve months 
overseas.

Finding myself alone in a public toilet block with a man known to 
have had great psychological disturbances.

After seeing an "uncertain" child work on a model for several 
hours, I watched a "bully" of the same age destroy it, telling 
the child that it was worthless.

Leaving home to move closer to University. As an oldest child, 
this experience was traumatic for both my parents and myself.

Viewing the results of senseless vandalism to a local primary 
school.

When I finished my exams after 12th Grade, I was worried about 
getting a T.E. Score high enough for Physiotherapy. When I found 
that I had been accepted I was ecstatic, or more appropriately, 
could jump for joy.

When going for my driver's licence for the third time, because 
everything, it seemed, hinged on getting it. I was really nervous, 
and the testing Officer made me a little afraid as well. There 
were lots of things to worry about. I passed however.

When a so-called friend let me down, when she promised to tell me 
when a certain concert was occurring, and that she'd get me 
tickets. I was really looking forward to it. She did nothing, 
just told me out of the blue one day what a fantastic concert it 
was going to be.

When my family heard that my Mother's cousin who lives in 
England wrote us to tell that he had cancer of the lymph glands.

When I found out how the people of Ethiopia were starving and 
their government was spending millions on celebrating being in 
power so many years. Then I saw all these people on TV needing 
food, etc.

Two years ago, somebody I like very much wanted to give up his 
studies. I tried to make him understand the importance of what he 
was going to do, not only of the difficulty to find a job but also 
because he will decrease his culture etc. This person made the 
test to the college entrance examination and to our great joy we 
found out that he succeded in entering at the University.

One night, when I got out from the University I saw two strange 
people near my car. When I got near, they moved away, and then 
came close again. I had a feeling that they were assaulters. 
After I left I discovered that the windshield was broken.

One day in a crossroad somebody crashed my car. I got out and 
this person laughed at me. I felt such a great anger that I got 
in my car and went away.

I don't know why suddenly I thought that what I was feeling for 
my boyfriend was not really love. After almost three years being 
together, this matter of fact shaked me and I felt a great sorrow 
that I can call sadness.

Returning home in the late afternoon I saw an indecent act made 
by a man with the purpose that I saw it.
When I entered at the University.

One night I and my friends went to the cemetery. We stopped the 
car in front of the wall and suddenly the grave digger appeared 
over the wall looking like a ghost. I was already afraid and 
almost died.

When one teacher unjustly gave me zero in a test saying that I 
was cribbing.
When my grandmother died.

I went to a restaurant with my boyfriend for dinner. There we saw 
a couple. the man of the couple was a negro and he hadn't manners 
for eat.

When in the end of a semester I got the approval in a matter that 
I judged very difficult.

Crossing a street of several ways the cars began to move and I 
thought that I was going to be trampled.

I went to the school library and asked for a book, but the 
librarian told me that there wasn't such. However when an other 
colleague asked for it she gave it to him.

Some colleagues decided to go out on a Saturday not inviting me 
to decide either the place nor the time.

A teacher giving a test was called by a student by his first 
name. He (the teacher) said that he didn't give him this liberty.

The situation in which I felt happiest in my life was when 
I was with the person I love for the first time.
Fear of thief.
I feel anger when somebody forbids me to do something.
I felt sad when I was despised by another person.
I felt disgust of dirty.

When I got through the examination for my driver licence, and 
when I finished I knew I had passed it.

I was inside the car with my husband and we were assaulted with a 
gun at 10 o'clock in the evening.
When they changed my office to another room without my agreement.

I couldn't sleep, and began to remind of my childhood. We are many 
sisters and at that time we were spanked a lot and I don't know 
why I started to remind of the spanks they and I had had, their 
shouts when this happened.

When I red a report in the magazine VESA about an Iranian telling 
what she had lived in the prisons in Iran. I felt disgust about 
that people.

I was in ILHA GRANDE with a wonderful sun, with wonderful people, 
with a wonderful sea, with a wonderful boy.

When I was looking for a job I felt a lot of fear but the fear 
was greater when I found it.

This feeling occurred to me when my colleague entered in G.V. 
(University) and I didn't.

When I applied for the college entrance examination to FUVEST, 
and I wasn't approved in the second fase.

I had this feeling when I met a girl, not that she was dirty but 
she was to "fresh", dump and childish.

I felt happy when my mother borrowed me the car in order to let 
me go out alone for the first time.

I felt afraid when I smoked maryhuana for the first time in my 
life with a lot of friends in the middle of the street at day 
brake.

I felt anger when I had a fight with my father, and he beated me. 
My mother came to help me (because I was beeing beated) and he 
also beated my mother.

It happened when I lost two very intimate friends in a car 
accident.
I felt disgust of my father when I knew he had a lover.
Always when I am well succeded.
When there is danger nearby.
I feel anger when things don't come out as I wish.
When I couldn't go for a trip with my friends in a holiday.
Disgust of drunkers and of blood.

When there was a possibility of getting on better in professional 
life. I valorized very much this aspect. People showed me this 
possibility, not the real fact (even because until now ...)

When I was curious about it and went to a spiritism session with a 
friend. I had already been there other times (many times when I 
was younger) but that day, even if I don't believe in 
spiritism I was terribly afraid that something would happen to me 
(sort of incorporation !).

When they denied a job to a person that I propsed giving political 
reasons that has nothing to do directly with the professional 
level.

During an informal talk with a friend when we talk about the life 
of another person, a common friend, that is in a situation of not 
being able to assume certain problems that he decided to solve, 
that is, she herself suggested the problems and decided to solve 
them but didn't get it until the moment.

When my friends and I were camping in a weekend, and with little 
food, we met a middle age couple from a small town that invited 
us to eat in their house. Their house was small, badly built with 
old and dirty forniture and utensils. The problem was with pans, 
and dishes, and even the food.
When I got a wedding ring of diamond from the boy I loved.
Afraid of getting alone without friends, without anybody.
When they stole my dark blue tennis.

When I became conscious that men don't wnat anything they don't 
have a goal. They have: sex, but this isn't important.

When I went in a clinical hospital and saw in what conditions 
people are attended there.

When I met again a great friend and talked a little while with 
him. When I see again another I miss.

I feel afraid of the way a great friend looks at me, and also a 
little afraid of the directions that it's going.

I felt anger of a friend when she met "a date" and become nervous 
and pest as she always gets when she meets him.

When I knew almost the same day about two great friends of mine 
that had serious existential crisis, and mainly when I notice 
that I'm in the same situation that they are, but I didn't 
realize it.

When some friends and I get acquainted a guy during vacations I 
thought he was disgusted and "a friend" of mine for whom I feel a 
little disgust wanted to stay with him.
When I entered University.

I have been afraid several times. What marked me was that I 
almost didn't enter University.

I'm crazy about football. When my team lost a goal in the Paulist 
championship, and so it lost the classifications.
When my grandmother, my second mother died.
When a girl that I liked didn't accept my curting.

When I met a girl and asked her for a date and she agreed, (I 
thought this girl would never like me), this was an emotion of 
joy.

The same fact about the girl (22 years, married - guilt - 
disgust), the fear was the main factor in our relationship.

About the car (sadness) I felt anger the way I acted after 
negotiating it.
To buy a car and didn't like the business and the car.

I met a girl (22 years old), married. I liked her. I asked her 
for a date and I kissed her. I discovered that she lived nearby 
where I passed every day. I got amused thinking that her husband 
would be ... or me . I didn't talked to her anymore.

I felt joy when I red my name in the list of the approved in the 
entrance college examination.

I was visiting my parents in law when the house was invaded by 
three strange men, and they committed an armed assault.

Nearby the end of the year my wife and I were having a car ride, 
when it appears another vehicle, driven by a drunk driver and 
provokes an accident.

To have a friend who I didn't see for months, and under the 
circumstances that I met him made me feel happy, and perhaps 
because it has been one of the good things that I learned with 
this friend.

When I left a carnaval ball at 4 o'clock a.m. I was alone in a 
foreign city and I had to go back home, when a guy appeared and 
tried to "catch me".

The fact that I hadn't been informed about something and I had the 
greatest trust in this person.

A friend of mine lent me his apartment for holidays and besides 
this he was a fine person. Months later I knew that he died 
tragically in a moto accident. He was very young, and I felt sad 
and couldn't believe it (until today).

In contact with a poor family of northeast it was offered to me a 
crab to eat at my request. But the fact that this crab was 
prepared antihygienically and his appearence was also 
antihygienically it caused me disgust but I ate it anyway.
When, after a long time of searching I got my first job.

After some time of work I was transferred to another place and in 
an other quite harder job.

When I used to go to my chief asking about any doubt about the job 
and he didn't care, didn't answer me, leaving me speaking alone.

When I knew that a person that I liked very much didn't react the 
way I would like to, even that I knew about his feelings for me.

When I knew that a person who I didn't like, had about me other 
feelings.
When a person that I like very much got near to me.

I was at home alone, and heard noises on the roof, and doorknobs, 
and drawers.

When a person is privileged in account of situations that are 
unjust, and disloyal to colleagues and friends.

When I was betrayed by a friend, and decided to stay apart form 
her.

After a serie of facts that occurred between a colleague and me I 
started to feel a certain necessity to get apart and I didn't want 
to see her anymore.

I made the college entrance examinations for P.U.C. It was what I 
wanted more. When the first list came out I got frustrated. I 
wasn't in. When the second list came out without hopes I started 
to read the newspaper and my name was thre. I was in the bus and 
felt like crying so that everybody could hear me. The cry was hold, 
and 1982 became forever a mask in my life.

I remember when I was a child of a storm that made me terribly 
afraid. I thought that the house was coming down and that in the 
next day I would be dead. Everybody was awake and I stayed all 
night in bed without falling asleep.

Once in my work it happened a fight between the person in charge and me. I 
got so angry and spoke out everything I felt at the moment.

I remember the day my father died. I was 11 years old and my 
sadness was so great that until today I remember everything 
about that day, from the clothes I was wearing to the reactions of people, 
the despair of my mother and brother. It marked me a lot and was 
the greatest sadness I felt.

I was sitting in school, waiting for my sister to go home. Suddenly a 
boy put fire in a paper and threw it were I was sitting. The 
paper didn't get me, but I felt terribly disgusted at this 
cowardliness and irresponsibility that caused a great 
discussion. We went to the director and he, drunk as always, said 
that I was ... attention in school. I felt disgust of this 
situation, and of the persons implicated in it.

The day I received the key of my apartment and we could enter in 
it, for my fiancT and I had bought it yet in plans, and it seemed 
to us that this was almost impossible to happen.

I had a driver licence but I didn't drive for a long time, than I 
started to drive again, and had to get into hard transit and 
highways.

When my boss cut off my vacations saying that in that month it 
wouldn't be possible, and after some time he let another girl 
take vacations that month. The anger was because of the 
resentment. Resulting from our bad relationship.

My fiancT's family was adopting a 5 years old boy. I felt 
myself close to him as I never felt before. After some time his 
mother demanded the care of the kid and we were obliged to send 
him back.

There is a girl at my work that doesn't take care much of her 
hygiene she comes always with her hair oiled, a not very agreable 
smell, and a bad appearance. Beside this she tries to be nice.

It was when a friend took me to a place and gave me as a gift my 
astrologycal map with the explanations of a psychologist.

When I was dreaming that I was being chased, in the upmost of 
horror the door of the closed felt down synchronicaly with the 
dream scare.

When my mother slapped me in the face, I felt anger at that 
moment.

When I deeply felt that I could lose the person I love best 
because of my foolishness.

I felt disgust toward meat when I felt sick with the steak after 
a week only on meat.

In a day when at work, in school, and relationships came out as I 
wanted, and I was recognized in my work.

When I woke up in the middle of the night because of a dream, it 
wasn't a nightmare, it was an uninteligible dream in wich I woke 
because of a certain end.
When I was robbed in a bus.
When I try to get closer at a person and she misinterpreted me.
When I felt the smell of industries that pollute.

I was travelling in the South of Brasil, near the end of the 
year. I was well settled with 3 friends. At the evening of 31 M., 
somebody, also with us, took from his purse pints of all colours, 
and the 4 of us, and other friends, that were at the same beach, 
painted each other and we went to the beach with champagne.

I was walking from my friend's house, a few blocks from my house, when a 
car began to follow me. He waited I passed by it rotateed a little and 
stopped on my way. I changed completely my way and the car went 
on following me until I turned at a corner and running I hid in a 
garden of a house, waiting for the car to pass by. I went back home 
terribly afraid.

One day I lent my tennis I just had washed to my sister because 
she asked it. I asked her not to soil it as I had just washed it. 
Next day I looked at the tennis, and it was dirty with wax. She 
could not have soiled it. It was lack of consideration. I felt 
very angry.

The second time I went to the entrance exam to V.S.P. and 
didn't get approved.

I was travelling, we were 15 person, one of them I met at the 
travel and didn't like her. One night I was asleep while she and 
her friends were talking too loud in the kitchen. I got up to ask for 
silence and since that day I felt constant disgust for her.

A friend of mine that is abroad undertook recently an axam to 
enter on University in Dallas, and was approved.

I felt afraid of losing somebody I love to another person because 
I was an incomprehensive person and lots of time I fight with 
this person.

In certain occasion I have a fight with my boyfriend. During the 
fight I closed the door at his face. He went away but came back 
next day.

Last year, when I took the college entrance examinations I 
failed the FUVEST. It was for me the most frustrating situation 
because I had studied all year long, and only thought about this.

In a certain occasion I saw a dog in the street eating something 
so strange gooey that I wasn't able to eat lunch because I 
remembered the scene all the time.
When I knew about my first job.
When I was just to be divorced.
My mother in law slept in my bed.
A terrible fight that I provoked with my friend.

In the last year of the high school we had a huge fight between 
my group and the graduation commission (two students of my 
classroom) because they accused us unjustly of a gossip about 
them.

When I was 10/11 years old my father travelled very much for his 
work (he passed three months away from home).

I saw a film where snakes were crawling everywhere. I felt them 
crawling over all my body with that ... skins. The noise that 
they did disturbed me very much.
When I got a small present form a person I like very much.

When a friend of mine discussed with me, I felt fear of losing 
her. This occurred because we had a missunderstanding between 
mutual colleagues.

When a boy tried to fool me so he would be OK trying to show me 
that he is a gook boy.

In the 12/83 my boyfriend asked me to forget him, as it would be 
easy.

When my oldest sister discovered that her boyfriend had another 
girl.

When I saw my name in the newspaper and I knew that I entered at 
the University.

When my father died I felt myself alone and the fear possessed me. 
I was a child and all my sisters and brothers (8) were young.

I loved a person and he went away. It wasn't necessary that he 
left me to reach his goals.

A close friend travelled to another country. When I knew that he 
would only come back after many years, I felt very sad.

I had a friend who I didn't see for a long time. We had a 
relationship from much union and interaction. It was more that 
one year that I didn't see her. She appeared in my home and we 
talked.

I was sitting on the bus coming back from school. A man from 
nearly forty years sat beside me. After a while I looked at him 
and saw that he was looking at me with opened throusers and 
holding his penis.

My mother was ill and asked me to prpare our lunch. I went to do it, 
and while I was working, she stayed behind me telling what I 
had, or not to do. I asked her to stop meddling, and to go to 
bed. When I went to ask for help to my sister, my mother said that 
I was proud, that I asked for help only when I wanted and that I 
wasn't able to cook by myself.

When on Christmas day my grandmother died. I received the 
news when I was coming back from a party on the 24th at 5 am.

The same event described under FEAR - in the bus a man sat beside 
me, with his trousers open and holding his penis.
When I got a record as a gift from a friend.
Once when I crossed the street, and was nearly trampled by a car.

A girl entered in the division where I work and greeted everybody 
but not me.
A dear friend was removed from the division whre I work.
When somebody despised a friend of mine.

I wanted to go out to walk but I didn't know either where or 
with whom, suddenly an invitation appeared.

Passing (by car) over a bridge where only one car could pass. There 
was a precipice on both sides, no protection grilles, and the 
bridge was completely muddled.
When my chief accused me of an error that I hadn't made.

When I knew about my sister's in law finacial situation and what 
she was facing.
To see damaged lettuce (with worms) in the icebox.

I felt a great joy when I knew that my father was going to sell 
the apartment from GUARUSA, because in some way we were helded by 
it, that means that we didn't go to any other place, because we 
had the apartment.

The day that there was a black-out in the city, and I was in an 
exposition, I felt fear that something more serious was 
happening, like a revolution for example.

I don't use to lie to my parets about what I do, and the two 
times that I felt anger were when they doubted me I said that I 
was going to the club, and they didn't believe me because the day 
before they had met me at FLIPERAMA. I had the wish to kill them.

I felt very sad when I saw the first list from the names of the 
people who entered at the University and my name wasn't there.

I felt disgust about all my friends. After having done a great 
effort to organize an evening together, and didn't work out, they 
put the blame on me. After this, I feel disgust towards those that 
blame me.

When I discovered that I and my friend would be licensed at the 
first call. This emotion was accompanied by a great relief. It 
was the coronation of a year of sacrifice and extrene discipline.

The week before I entered to army, when we were being selected. 
During 5 days I had to pass 10 hours a day waiting for the 
answer, which at last was the worst. The fear of being convoked, 
of hearing the fated phrase, was constant.

When I was misleaded by a person who assured that something would 
not occur, that I had no reason to prepccupy myself, and suddenly 
I saw myself implicated by the fact, because of the incompetence, 
and irresponsibility of that person.

When I didn't succeed to enter at the University, I felt that the 
college entrance course sistem prejudiced me, that my integrity, 
and effort weren't corresponded.
When I had to plunge in a swamp of fetid and stagnant water.
I felt joy when I entered at the University.

One day, when I realized that I was alone, I felt fear of 
loneliness.

I felt anger when I saw that I was being misleaded by my 
boyfriend, he went out with other girls. I felt anger for his 
falsity.

When my boyfriend was changing his behavior there was something 
wrong, I felt sad, because it's desagreable when a relationship 
is ending.

I felt disgust when I realized that I had eaten something fatty, 
and vomited too much.

A meeting with the family and the friends I felt dear and loved, 
sharing the gladness of being together at a birthday.
When I saw a horror film.

When my sister took something that belonged to me without my 
permission.
When I felt alone and without love.

When I visited a creche. The conditions weren't too precarious 
but the children were in conditions of physical and emotional 
penury.

After making an effort to enter at University I found a course 
and a school of higher education which were compatible with my 
experience and potentiality.

I had an important amount of money with me and felt fear of being 
assaulted.

When I realized that the person I was courting hadn't been really 
by my side for a long time already. He had deceived me and I let 
him deceive me.
When I noticed that I do many things to the pregiudice of myself.

Seeing persons spending money in a shopping center with 
completely indifference to the misery reigning in our country.

I felt joy when I passed the worst phase in my life and 
discovered how many people considered me important to them.

I felt fear some months ago of losing the person whom I loved 
when she said to me that she didn't love me.

I felt much anger and perhaps I feel it till now, against my 
girlfriend's sister who incited her to betray me just when I 
needed her very much. She didn't think of anything, simply 
passed over everything.
When my dog died.

About my girlfriend's sister who is a viper as I discovered some 
time ago.

I didn't like my former fob and felt joy when I received a 
telegram offering me a new one that I though better and for which 
I had been waiting.

I was in a train where a fight occurred. One person who was there 
opened his handbag and took out a gun, another who fought too 
looked among his things for a weapon to fight.

Without the employer's knowledge and even without any 
communication their bank accounts were changed and their personal 
accounts closed.

My brother wanted me to buy a flute with him but I didn't accept 
afterwards I regretted it because he became sad.
I felt disgust when I saw a dead animal on the roadway.

The day that my boyfriend appeared at home with a pair of rings 
for our wedding.

One day I was near home, kissing my boyfriend in a car when my 
mother appeared and asked me to go home, because she didn't know 
about the event.

A ex-boyfriend tried to prejudice me before my fiancT and his 
family saying things about me that let his family worried. We had 
to postpone our wedding and we were already using our wedding 
rings. To be honest I didn't feel just anger, I felt hate.

The day that the results of the college entrance examinations for 
the S. Paulo University were published and I didn't find my name 
on the list. Entering this University was my greatest wish, and 
the fact of not having succeded caused a great frustration, and 
not only sadness.

When I saw the film "Memorie of Prison" I saw a scene of 
masturbation of a man in the hold of a ship apart form fact that 
the film wasn't pleasant I had a leg of coconut candies in my 
hands.
When people remember us and shows interest about what we do.
When I had to talk with an important person about a job.

When my brother went out with my new shirt that I adored, and 
returned it dirty with grease.

I felt sadness when I notice that I'm not important for a 
determinate person. We do many things for a friend, and we see 
soon after, that he doesn't do anything for us, nor thinks of us.

When I needed another job and tought that a good and known person 
(my employer) could help me. He simply said that he couldn't help 
me.

I felt glad to live again when I went to a meeting about the 
"Knowledge". There are 4 techniques of meditation that connect 
you with the essence of the human being.

I received a phone call from a high school friend whose younger 
sister studied with me at the University and gave me a lift every 
moning. She was going to get married to a guy whom I knew too and 
who had died when he fell from a building, I was afraid to lose 
somebody since I had already lost a brother in an accident.

My grandmother is a highly authoritative person, who lives alone, 
is independent, but doesn't know to live without commanding the 
others. I hate this!

I am always sad when my boyfriend goes away. He lives and studies 
in an other city. We have gone steady for 2 and 1/2 years and 
everything is going very well, but sometime this situation makes 
me feel bad and very lonely.

I felt disgust when I kissed a guy that I know. I was on the outs 
with my boyfriend and this person appeared but he has nothing to 
do with me.
When I bought my car.

I was alone at home, a man forced the front door which was 
locked, forced and tried to open a window.
When I had a serious argument with a dear person.

One night a very dear person said: "I hate you". Of course it was 
an impulse and this person didn't feel that about me. The person 
expressed regret, and everything was settled, but I can't forget.
When I met my boyfriend with another girl.
The birth of my daughter.

I should have given a test lesson to get a job. I had no courage. 
I didn't make the test.

Discussion with my mother about the way to educate my children. I 
felt anger against my mother.
When my grandmother died.

I was returning from the Universtity at night when I was accosted 
by a boy who molested me, passing his hands on my body.

I found a human "treasure" that I desired and got immediately. I 
didn't think about anything. When I touched him I imploded but I 
am whole.

I was in the dark room, it's insecure and has holes covered with 
wooden sheets in the roof the establishment had already been 
assaulted and could be assaulted again.

And she said absurd things, false things that filled my ears and 
inflated my head which seemed to be caught in a carcass where the 
heart wanted to explode and where the arm wanted to knock down 
the world.

One day I heard from a friend that the boy I loved had gone out 
with her and not with me.

I saw a magazine with photographs of dead and maimed people whose 
limbs were separated from their body like a head on one side and 
the leg on the other.

One of the greatest joiy was when I succeded in acquiring a 
motorcycle through my own efforts.

I'm afraid of driving on the special seat of a mororcycle, mainly 
with certain colleagues who by exces of self-confidence drive 
beyond limits or measure in the traffic and the main victim is 
always the person who sits behind the driver.

I felt much anger when my fahter interferred in my relations with 
another person whom I liked very much, ending something that I 
adored.

One of the greatest sadness was when my grandfather died, because 
I loved him very much.

My main disgust is against codfish because I detest even the 
smell of it.

When I got a stereo walkman from my father when he had finacial 
difficulties. I thought that although he promised to give me that 
present, he was not obliged to do so.
That someone would discover whom I really love.

When a colleague was rude with me because she didn't understand 
the subject about which I was discussing.

For not having succeded in getting the job as a translator that I 
wanted.

When I saw a man who hadn't the lower .... in a car 
exhibition. He was passing a handkerchief from inside to outside 
of his mouth.

When I passed the whole weekend with my boyfriend, coming back 
home on Sunday afternoon he met my parents for the first time.

When there was a fight at home and my father threatened to throw 
a chair on my brother.

I felt anger against a person who told bad things about me in my 
absence.

After a disagreement between my parents, when I was alone with my 
father and my sister, the aggression continued, when my father 
tried to put me and my sister against my mother revealing facts 
that had happened in the past like a talk between my father and 
his mother in law where she told him that my mother was not quite 
save.
When in my childhood we were forced to take cod-liver oil.

I was in the living room at home with an ex-boyfriend, it was 
nearly a year that we had separated, during the talk he began to 
remember our courting and gave me a long kiss.

I was with a friend in a stationed car when, suddenly a man 
appeared on my side and an other with a gun on his side the 
hold-up lasted a few minutes but it was terrible. I had never 
seen a gun so close.

I was on a farm with a few friends and during the talk I 
discovered that a friend of mine, was being betrayed by her 
boyfriend and a 3rd friend of ours.

I was watching television. It was about midnight when a very dear 
friend called saying that his father had died in an accident.

I was working in a classmate's house with a group. A girl began 
to graze her foot against mine under the table.
Always when I meet the person I love.

When I and the person mentioned above had a suspicion of 
pregnancy.

When I left after the examination to enter the University, and 
even though I had studied the whole year I made a bad exam.

When I thought for an instant that a very good relationship with 
a person had finished.
When I heard the bad news about the death of a close person.
When I entered in the University after a year of struggles.

Practicing wind-surf my body was caught under the sail. On trying 
to get out my leg was caught in the lashing. I was afraid of 
dying by asphixia.

In the University we were convoked to a stroll like a freshman I 
was still innocent about the manipulation. On seeing the goal of 
the exaltation to poor character people, I felt anger on feeling 
myself mass of maneuver.

In a social situation I became interested in a woman. We talked, 
we laughed, we enjoyed each other. She desappeared for a few 
minutes, and a little after appeared with an other man.

I saw a man falling on the walkway. He seemed half dead, and was 
immobile. I felt disgust for the people who passed by without 
doing anything to help.

A friend of mine travelled very far. I miss her but feel joy too 
because fer life is taking the right direction as she wants. So I 
feel joy for her mainly.

Motorcyclistic accident where for some minutes I didn't know if I 
was alive or dead, I remained "cold levered" during the situation 
but felt great fear.
When I met my mother after months of absence.
When I whatched a horror film on a Friday 13th.

Discussing with a certain person about a job I was getting and 
that perosn was negative and pessimistic.
When I felt lack of aid from close friends.

When I saw a fight I had a physical reaction of disgust and of 
deep perturbation.
I got a present from a great friend (a dog).

There was a scene of shooting in front of my house, I was very 
afraid. Two armed men confronting. I didn't discover the reason 
of the incident.

I was waiting to receive the participation on the profits and did 
not receive it.
I didn't get the job I wanted.

I went to eat at my aunt's house and she served macaroni with a 
horrible appearence. I felt the sensation above. The worst was 
that I was practically obliged to eat.
When I can see my parents because now I am far from them.
When I sit for examinations.
Once, during a performance I did not sing the way I had to.
When I got separated from the woman I loved.
When the Americans set their nucleaar missiles in Europe.
When I was admitted to the Bulgarian State Conservatoire.
I am afraid if I'll finish the term.
I was angry when my abilities of a singer were underestimated.

I feel sadness from the fact that I was not born with a better 
appearance.

I was disgusted with the hypocrisy of my colleagues from the 
group.
I have a new born child.
I could have been killed by a falling object.

At a certain situation I felt myself neglected and undeservedly 
harmed.
The sudden death of one of my parents.

Getting separated from my family for a week caused me a sense of 
sadness.

I felt it when I saw a colleague of mine eating like a beast. At 
the same time he was making gestures, speaking and making the 
hell of a noise.

I felt joy most strongly some years ago, when I took part in a 
NH Competition and I was the first.

I feel fear when I only imagine I could lose confidence in my own 
abilities and powers. A similar feeling I feel sometimes before 
an exam.

I feel anger when I see a "parent" beating and punishing his child 
in the street. Recently I was a withness of a similar case.

I feel sadness when I only imagine that I could lose a close 
person. Some time ago I lost a man whom aI greatly respected.

A similar feeling I felt quite recently while travelling in a 
taxi. The driver treated me roughly and dishonestly - he chose 
the longest route, he overdrawed almost one lev more and he tried 
to be intimate with me.
When my nephew was born. The birth was hard, it was a big baby.

Late one night I was pursued by gipsies who had no good 
intentions.

My brother accused me undeservedly before my parents. I was not 
guilty. He was misled by his wife.

When I left my boyfriend. I found another girl at his home but he 
did nothing to relieve the situation.

I found a big black beetle in my coffee cup. It was alive big and 
it was moving its limbs.

Some time ago I was present at the wedding party of two close 
friends of mine.

I was crossing the street together with some colleagues of mine 
when I suddenly found myself almost under the wheels of a truck.

Someone stole my ski at Vitosha and of course I was the one to be 
blamed. I left them without supervision.
I got separated form my closest friend. He went to work abroad.

A drunk man had fallen in the street and he was shouting obscene 
words.

An encounter with a man whom I love, after a very long 
separation.

I woke up in the middle of the night of a nightmare, I was alone, 
it was very quiet and very dark.

A shop-assistant behaved rather roughly with me though she hadn't 
the slightest grounds for it.

I saw a friend of mine who had suffered a very heavy contusion 
after an accident.
I caught a glimpse of a black-beetle.
At a success of mine, at a real achievement.

I was looking after a dying patient at work one night, a young 
woman, my colleague was talking to her relatives and .... to 
offer them any support emotionally, physically and then sent them 
down to the coffee shop to have a dinner rather than offering the 
facilities available for their use cause it involved her having 
to do some work. Seeing them again I felt disgusted at her 
attitude.
For the first time in my life telling someone I loved them.

When I was ringing up a guy who was my teen idol, and was in 
Auckland. I was really scared, I didn't know what to say or do.

When my mother decided to clean out my room and throw out what 
she thought was junk, without my knowing about it, so I returned 
home to find half my stuff gone.
When I couldn't find my dog which was missing.

I was disgusted with a friend's behaviour when she got absolutely 
drunk so that she vomitted all over my house.

When I met my boyfriend and we discovered that we shared the same 
ideals and goals in life, and that we could share all our 
feelings and thoughts and felt that the world's not so bad when 
you have someone really close to share your life with.
When I passed the driving test after three failures.
When I nearly caused a traffic accident with my car.

When playing a football match, there was one player who made mean 
tackels, kicked at everything and did things having nothing to do 
with football.

A close friend decided to stop with his study and to go back 
home.

We had a birthday party with 5 friends. One of us frequently used 
hard drugs. On the party I discovered that the other 3 friends 
also used them. While we agreed we would help the big user to 
stop using it.
For instance when a girl is interested in me and likes me.

Walking at friday night through Nijmegen, going to a pub or a 
disco.

I felt dusgust with a self-iterested person who ruined the life 
of another by means of utterly unfair methods.

I sensed this feeling when I passed successfully the second tour 
of a competition.
I felt fear when my mother was heavily ill.

I felt anger against a colleague of mine during a rehearsal in 
acting. He hadn't learnt the text of an opera act in the course of 
several months and thus making difficulties for the rest of my 
colleagues.

I felt sadness when I had to get separated from the woman I loved 
who had to leave for her motherland.

I felt disgust with the alcohol, after I happened to see a young 
man, who was dead to the world and who wallowed on the pavement. 
This "sight" I watched from the bus.

I was happy when at difficult times I could find support in my 
friend and my fiancT, I was happy because of their spiritual and 
moral help which gave me new power to struggle. I was happy then, 
I felt it in my soul.
I felt it at the same time when I felt disgust.

I felt it on the same occasion when I felt sadness which finally 
grew into anger.

My living and working conditions at home were unbearable. We used 
to live in a three room flat together with two more families. The 
discords caused a change - one of the families moved out. The 
other family stayed with us but I drifted away from my fiancT. In 
fact we were two families in the flat. Then I found myself alone 
in the struggle for this life because my fiancT did not stay next 
to me my grief and sorrow took on large proportions. I wanted to 
commit suicide but instead I threw myself against the cause of 
the irritation.

I am disgusted with my sister's husband. On an early Sunday 
morning after having knocked at my door, he suddenly rushed in 
and finching me still in bed he began quarrelling about 
something. I could not understand. I heard his last words: "Don't 
stare at me so because I'll beat you in your bed" I got up 
terrified and a thrashing followed.

That was what I felt when I was finally accepted in the Bulgarian 
Conservatorie after I had applied a couple of years.

I experienced this feeling when the doctors found a nodule in one 
of my mother's breasts. It turned out to be an occlusion 
resulting from continious sucking but for a few days I was not in my 
reason.

I had an accident with a trafic police car that was packed at a 
curve without any visibility and against all traffic regulations 
in a strong snowstorm. As a result I still cannot repair my car 
because of the missing spare parts.

A sudden doubt made me run for a long time in a rainy autumn 
night. When I reached the intended place I saw my beloved in 
another man's arms. A sudden blow, grief, I cannot qualify it, it 
is painful for me to remember about it.

I felt disgust with a man I had trusted and respected, to whose 
problems I had always shown deep understanding.
My boyfriend made me a proposal.

I was to be given an audition to get a role. I had a competitress 
and I wasn't well prepared because I was ill.

A whole crowd of us went to a folklore festival. The instructor 
of the cast where my boyfriend played was traveling with us. We 
decided to catch the train that leaved early in the morning 
because we had business on the following day. The instructor 
tried to get the upper hand and made us catch the train in spite 
of everything, all the time he made me angry.
When I quarrelled with my boyfriend.

I am disgusted with the fact that bad singers play at the opera 
(and not only there) only because they are protegTs or lovers of 
an important felow while at the same time some young and able 
singers work in a quite different field of life.

When I heard what mark I had got at the entrance examination and 
I realized my admittance to the University was almost certain.

Once I was alone at home. I suddenly felt unwell and there was no 
one to help me and call First Aid.

When I was admitted to a Language school. On the day when I was 
informed by a message and my parents congratulated me.

When diving deep into the sea to reach the floor I felt 
breathless. I was cautious but I doubted I should be able to come 
to the surface and inhale.

When my friend (girl) promised to help me go to the hospital and be 
examined by good experts and she deceived me.

When I had stayed abroad for a long time and I had remembered 
about my friends and relatives. I felt sad and I wanted to see 
them as soon as possible.

I felt it when I saw our headmaster blushed ingratiating himself 
with high ranking officials.

When you are satisfied with something, when you achieve something 
you have striven to.

One fears many things, for example one fears going to the 
dentist. but as far as I am concerned this feeling is connected 
with the examination session.

When you are unjustly assessed at something you are sure to have 
been right.

For the loss of a close friend or relative, but you feel grief 
when you are away from home, too.
They wanted something to happen but I didn't.
I couldn't be with a girl on whom I was very keen.

I and my friends got acquainted with a guy from Sofia who turned 
out to be gay, but we found that out only after 2 or 3 days.
Having passed an exam.
Having a car accident.

I shared a secret with a friend and it later turned out that he 
had revealed it to another person with whom I didn't get along very well.
The loss of a very good friend.
Negative statement concerning me of a friend before strangers.

I'm glad when I have good relations with my colleagues and most 
of all when we are at a party.

I experienced it once when we were on a drive. Our car passed by 
the one comming from the opposite direction at an incredibly 
small distance.

I get angry with people who attain certain status without 
deserving it, only with the support, authority and influence of 
other people.

I feel sad when I see things done against men and nothing could 
stop it - at least I think so.

I have experienced disgust with some people - usually double 
dealers.

I experienced it when I was accepted at the Medical Higher 
Institute.
I felt it when I sat for my exam in anatomy.

I experience that feeling when I am unsulted without deserving 
it or when someone deceives me.
When my grandfather died.
I feel disgusted with toadies, hypocrites, chameleons.
After each successfully passed exam I am happy.

A friend of mine gave birth to a child. Very dangerous delivery. 
I was afraid for her and for the baby.

I get angry when someone imputes on me things I never can do, 
naturally negative. Servility, "connections", impudence, traits 
that get me mad.

My brother is a soldier. He promised to come home in a furlough 
but in the last moment he phoned and said that he could not come.
I am disgusted with liers, hypocrites, slanderers, flunkeys.

After the term exams I happened to meet a person that I respect 
and of whom I think very highly. It was nice that although we see 
each other rarely he had not forgotten me.

Few years ago my father was very ill. He stayed at a hospital for 
a long time. Then I experienced that terrible feeling that I 
might lose him.

I have a friend that I deeply trusted but it happened that I lost 
my confidence in her for which she herself was to blame.

We are several friends but our characters are very different and 
we inevitably split in the two extremes. It is sad that I myself 
don't know what to do, I try not to hurt either of the "parties" 
because there are conflicts to which one I should belong.

I stayed for several weeks with a friend of mine before she moved 
to live with her husband. One evening he came drunk and made an 
awful scene, which I still remember.

I experienced this feeling when I was accepted as a student. 
Because everything turned out different from my expectations. 
Although I passed the exam successfully I was accepted as a 
student only when I didn't expect it at all, namely at the 
beginning of September.

In the real sense of the word I experienced fear in my first 
months in the army. During my first night of duty. The cause for 
all this was a bear. I became panic sticken (may be for the first 
time) and even forgot that I had a gun.

When I was a soldier I quarrelled with my commander and may be in 
revenge for this he detailed me on duty two successive nights. 
Naturally he checked me up on the second night and found me 
asleep for which he sent me to the cells.

Sometimes I experience sadness for the Sports High School and for 
my unrealized dreams in the sport. Anyway there I spent six years 
of my life.

Sort of awkward. I'd introduced (a lover) but introduced as a 
friend to some members of my family, and my niece Yavanna who's 
six was home from school and at Mum's and Dad's and was really 
silly and at first it was ok, but it went on and on - yukky pooh! 
You eat your snot, etc. and I felt cross she wouldn't stop. But 
she had an audience and was in one of those moods. Once I'd 
accepted it was something everyone does at time I felt better - 
it was partly having my friend there.
Spontaneous picnic with sister and friend and children - great.
Can think of no time that I have felt fear.

Teenage neighbours smashed my letterbox for the fifth time in a 
couple of months. It was a deliberate action of kids who had 
stayed in my home, had meals there yet took a dislike to my 
daughter.
Guy I cared for went back to Canada to live.

Bus driver driving roughly - old man fell off seat into aisle - 
driver wouldn't stop - disgusted with her behaviour.

Meeting with two of my friends I had not seen for 15 years. They 
were special people to me.

I was in the Korean War. We were attacked with mortars, me and 
companion. We stopped the jeep and ran for cover. Fortunately 
neither of us was hit but we both came close to being killed.

I've a situation of responsibility an employee who had a habit of 
being late, came late again after promising to say he would be at 
work in a few minutes, then arrived 3 hours later. He had been 
drinking.

My brother in law was dying of cancer. To see him wasting away 
was very sad.
Disgust at myself when I stroked a sleeping girl's private parts.

When we took out an 84 year old woman for the evening and had 
hamburgers. She described the evening out as her happiest night 
out in 20 years.

While tramping on a narrow path two of us were confronted by a 
woman with two snarling dogs, demanding we get off the property - 
via a flooded river !

A friend got angry and drove "like a lunatic" with me and others 
in his car. I was angry about his dangerous driving.

A boy I look after for the probation service deliberately 
offended to provoke a reaction from the police.

4-letter words on a TV programme (Roche) while we were 
entertaining "conservative" relations who wanted to see the first 
episode.

I was seriously injured in a road accident. The very first steps 
I took with only one crutch to support me I felt so good. I enjoy 
being alive.

I was attacked, standing in a doorway, by a pack of 5 dogs, 
alsatians and farm dogs with my escape route blocked by a shut 
fence.

In the house where I live there is a new flatmate. His friends 
unfortunately are the dirt of society, intelligent, fashonable, 
rich and bored. At a party recently they were doing things I 
didn't like done in my house. I felt angry at them.

I was driving near my girlfriend's house and I decided to keep 
going because it was late and I would be back in the next few 
days anyway. The next day she was killed in a road accident.

My girlfriend came home after a business dinner at the most 
expensive place in town drunk as a skunk. Whats more she drove 
home and couldn't remember doing so. I was disgusted by her state 
and her actions.

When I found out that a set task (i.e. 2 essays and a test), the 
thought of which had oppressed me, were not on the date I had 
thought.
When confronted and in my opinion hassled by the police.

Disgust - no. Maybe it is more precise to say revultion at a worm 
or a snake. But I mean it in a social aspect when somebody had 
behaved like a scoundrel to you, when by his actions he has made 
you change your attitude towards him but I thing this feeling the 
way I meant it, is not typical for the people interrelations.

When, for example, I was in my eleventh school year and I learned 
I had been classed for the Bulgarian Language and Literature 
National Olympiad.

When, for example, my grandfather fell seriously ill. It was 
necessary for him to be operated and I felt great fear of losing 
him because he is so dear to me.

When, for example, I was not approved to continue my studies at 
the Moscow University, no matter that I had the highest marks and 
in general the best records of all the candidates.

When, for example, I left for the first time my parents and I 
went to live in Sofia.
When, for example, someone is calumnating.

Some time ago a close relative of mine got off cheap with the 
worst.
The last time I felt it was when I was coming home late at night.
I haven't often felt this feeling. Once someone stole my garment.
Recently I happened to remain alone for a long time.

I don't remember about a situation when I have experienced this 
feeling. Maybe it was when I saw a drunkard in the street.

Realizing one's desire, an experienced feeling of satisfaction 
from the realization of one's desires and aims.

Fear of the loss of a close friend, of feeling the ground slipping 
from under my feet.

Attitude to some manners of dealing and some "sanctioned" 
relations.

Feeling unable to preserve one's ideas and ambitions as innocent 
as they are when you are young.
Attitude to a related family.
I won a sport contest.
If a close relative's life is in danger.
A close person lied to me.
Getting separated from my girlfriend.
Encouter with a prostitute.
When my son was born.
Before an examination.
Unjust punishment of a friend of mine.
After the loss of a close relative.

When somebody behaves like a scoundrel. Recently a colleague of 
mine used the name of another one for his own benefit.
Meeting a loved man.

I felt a physical fear, if I can call it this way, today, in the bus where 
I was sitting on the first seat. While turning the driver didn't 
see the tram which was making a dash towards us (coming from the 
side I was), and whose driver intended to cross in yellow 
light.

At an unjust, or to be more precise, at a bureaucratic treatment 
of one's personality.
When one is alone and knows that all the others are celebrating.
At the sight of an insect, such as the black-beetle.

I sensed such a feeling when I understood I was admitted to the 
University. I was at home, the atmosphere was still, though I 
myself was full of suspense. I tried to do different things. When 
the telephone rang and...! Yes, of course there were other 
situations when I felt a similar feeling but I was unmindful of 
them.

This feeling I sensed quite recently. It was arisen by the 
terrific thought that I might lose the man I loved !

Anger I felt when my boyfriend told me he didn't mind breaking it 
off with me, i.e. each of us to take his own road. Because until 
that moment, he deliberately restricted our dates. The motives 
were brought to my knowledge later.

Sometimes, when I'm alone I am seized by this feeling. But it 
always helps me to come round and at the same time to judge if it 
is worth. Very often this feeling is caused to me by people - 
friends who I love and respect.

Such a feeling springs up in me sometimes when I have meals at a 
catering establishment. It is a result either of the look of the 
food or when watching the way some people eat.
When I was admitted to the University.

I had to have my tonsils out. I had been making up my mind almost 
for a year - I was afraid. But during the two hours in the 
hospital room, while I was waiting to be called for the operation I 
felt a real fear - of the pain, of what they were going to do to 
me, of the unknown.

In a conversation my boyfriend expressed definite and quite 
pretentious opinions and he took up an attitude towards a theory 
which he himself had never known. His information was from 
fortuitous sources.

Summer, heavy rain, storm - I was standing with my face stick to 
the window: the childhood, something was going away forever this 
summer, I was leaving my home, I was going to study in another 
town, for the first time I was leaving my parents, friends, I had 
to manage myself, a long and loved period of my life was over - I 
was crying.
I saw in the street a man spitting.
When I understood that I was admitted to the University.

I felt this feeling when one day my landlord's cat had crept 
under my bed and I couldn't cope with it during an hour and a 
half.

I feel this feeling when I am to fill in a questionnaire or a 
form.
When the man I loved decided to leave me forever.

I have felt this feeling when a person whom I believe and respect, 
lied to me.

A quarrel was followed by the decision of leaving a person close 
to me. Several days later my regret was great. I was beside 
myself. Quite unexpectedly he came and the conflict was calmly 
solved. I was glad at the possibility to be with him.

One evening I was watching the news on TV. Again they were 
talking about the danger of war. Suddenly I imagined what it 
might mean for me, for my friends, for the people close to me. I 
felt it a very near and possible event.

Unfair and unjust attitude toward a person close to me, what I 
was the witness of, caused anger in me.

The thought that I'll never sit at the school desk again, caused 
a deep grief at the end of my eleventh form.

I felt disgust with a person whose behaviour was out of the 
elementary human norms.
When I understood I was admitted to the Sofia University.

I broke my knee when I was skiing over "Yastrebetz" (a racing 
track in a Bulgarian winter resort).

The doctors from Belogradchik town determined a wrong diagnosis 
to my son. A month later, after some complex examinations at ISUL 
(A medical institute in Sofia), the diagnosis was categorically rejected.

My son lives with my parents in the country and I feel this 
feeling always when leaving for Sofia, but the last time it was 
quite strong.

A colleague of mine asked a lecturer to put him a higher mark in 
order to keep his good mards and thus to continue getting a 
scholarship for an excellent grade.

I am a sportwoman as well. I felt joy when after an year of 
practice, at a contest, I covered the norms for "a master of sports".

I felt fear once, when the car in which I travelled directed 
towards the precipice along the road.

When I see how people around me pass by certain unjustice because 
of indifference or cowardice.
When I left a man in whom I really believed.
Disgust with drunk people.
When I was admitted to the University.
When I broke my leg I felt fear.
When someone lies to me.
At an unjust insult or injure.

From the cigarette smoke. Usually I feel disgust from it when I 
am in a restaurant.
When my affairs with the girl I love settled positively.

In a dam lake, when the water was let flow to water the plants 
and I and two other boys were near the water pit. We rescued 
ourselves only thanks to the flippers and the tyre that was with 
us.

It was quite recently, at the football match between the national 
teams of Bulgaria and France. I felt strong anger with the Scottish 
referee who ran the match quite partially.

When I am alone and listen to a song which I like very much and 
which I had listened before together with friends.
A striking act of ingratitude at a public vehicle.

I passed successfully the preliminary exam for a participation in 
the children Assembly.

I was alone in my room at the boarding house when at 12 o'clock 
someone knocked violently on the door.

A friend of mine promised to come with me to the cinema but he 
didn't come.

I felt sadness when I remembered my former boyfriend with whom I 
got separated an year ago and when comparing him with my present 
one with whom things are not much of a success.

Recently in the tram, a man ran his fingers over my girlfriend 
then over me.
Bulgaria won a football match against France.
I was going to knock down a pedestrian with my car.
I was neglected undeservedly.
My grandmother died.
A man was unfair to a girlfriend of mine.
I felt joy when my two twin sisters were born.

The night before my wife had given birth to our twins. I felt 
fear in the hospital yard, I feared if everything was going to be 
in order.

About a month ago the Regional Council refused to pay my wife the 
due maternity benefit, because of bureaucratic reasons.

Some months ago my wife gave birth to twin sisters. She had no 
idea of looking after babies and she felt quite oppressed. The 
fact that I couldn't help her caused grief to me.

I feel disgust with some people when I see what they are capable 
of, including lack of any dignity, when trying to find a seat in 
the tram.

The period when I was pregnant and when I gave birth to my son. 
I can say those were the happiest months in my life.

A fear from the loss of a close friend as a result of his 
behavior.

When I encountered not only with my father's lack of 
understanding but also with his unwillingness to understand me as 
a parent, as far as things for which I (not he) have proves to be 
right are concerned.
From the fact that my husband and I are not in good terms.

I was disgusted from a quarrel between two married people, in 
which the children were involved as accusers of one of the 
parents.

I felt joy when I saw my daughter after a separation of twenty 
days.

I felt fear when I sat for one of my exams. Though my fear was 
not quite justifiable, I still remember about it.

I thought him a good friend but he tried to lie to me several times. 
Last time was the height of impudence. He promised he would come 
home but he didn't. I felt a sense of anger and insult.
A fear of lack of personal powers.

At an undeserved attitude toward a man, when human personality is 
not treated decently.
At an irrevocable loss (with respect to human relations).

At an unworthy behaviour of a man, pettiness, stupidity and 
mostly at a philistinism.
When I was admitted to the University.

Because of a conflict with my parents there was a possibility to 
interrupt my studies.
I feel a strong anger when I am treated unjustly.
At a prolonged separation with my family.

I was looking for an object when I came across a rotten corpse of 
a rat.
The day when my son said for the first time "mummy".
Before an exam in logics.

My husband and I were invited at the house of our nieghbours then 
we got an invitation on the part of my parents which we had to 
refuse. A a result they called me by words that provoked my 
anger.

My son lives in the country. I feel sadness when I see mothers 
having walks with their children.

The behaviour of a colleague of mine, which doesn't correspond to 
my norms of behaviour.

The sense of joy comes to me always after a period of depression, 
as an organic feeling for an upsurge. I don't exclude the 
situative feeling but in this case the reason is not in me, it's 
out of me.

I bet that I would jump down from a window. I was sure that I 
would jump but before I did it I rather felt fear.

A honest "sliding" on the part of a girlfriend of mine. 
Terribly crossed I started breaking things and tearing books.

Alone I am coming back home in the night after the serial 
"explanation".
A lie on the part of a person close to me.
My son was born.
I had a car accident.

I was drawn up a statement for an infringement of the traffic 
ordinance. In fact I was innocent.
I lost a close friend.

I saw a film about the nazi concentration camps during the war. 
After the film I felt disgust.

After 10 days of hard work and having suffered many changes I 
passed my last exam.
