Before going to the dentist.

When I am made to do things in which I see no sense and I waste 
my time. Some time ago I had to participate in a sociological 
investigation and then I got really angry.

When I feel I must be with somebody, to talk with somebody - but 
I am alone.

Some time ago a man tried to teach me something. "Tried" because 
it is very difficult to teach somebody when you yourself are not 
competent and cultured.

When I am with friends and I do what pleases me this often 
happenes.

When I have to go in for an exam and the examinor is a person 
with a whimsical character and unsteady requirements.

I unfairly got a low mark on an exam and I failed to win a grant, 
since then I don't have much confidence in myself at an exam.
It happened that I was alone - with no contacts with friends.

I met three drunk boys, almost children, they didn't look like 
normal people.

I was happy when I understood that the girl I liked was in love 
with me.
I am afraid before an exam or colloquium.

I get angry when my smaller brother misbehaves and talks with indecent 
words.
When my dog was stolen.

I detest any kind of constraint and hate the attempts of elder 
people to force me to a norm of behavior without having legal or 
moral rights to do it. I felt this emotion when a neighbour of 
mine made me kick out my guests because they had talked very 
loudly and threatened that with "connections" she will expel me 
from the inst.
When I met with friends that I hadn't seen for a long time.

One evening a friend of mine was telling a fearful story, nobody 
took it seriously but I got frightened.

I got angry with a stranger in a train who behaved impertinently 
and immorally
When I failed at the first entrance exam.
The event which got me angry got also an aversion in me.

Six months ago when I got acquaintanced with a person whom I 
trusted infinitely and from whom I expected help and friendly 
feelings. With him I found much in common - in our views and in 
our fate.

Few days ago I really experienced fear. It was connected with 
unexpected actions on the part of a group of people. This evoked 
in me many negative emotions.

I always get angry when somebody deceives me, or tries to conceal 
his lie skilfully and this offends me even more.

Sadness - this is an emotion which I have felt very often 
recently. I can't remember a concrete example. I will describe my 
general impression from severl situations which evoked this 
feeling in me.

I became disgusted with the man on whom I had counted, who I had 
trusted, the man who should have been my mainstay - my father. 
I could hardly make myself (and the others) believe in this 
emotion. It has cumulated after events and deeds. Everything can 
happen in this world.
When I was accepted as a student.

I was a bit frightened when it was found that there was something 
wrong with my liver. However it turned out that it was not 
serious and I need not worry.

With the girl whom I may be loved truly. When she refused to come 
with me to an occasion (she was from another town).

For the girl who halped me go on living and made me happy - when 
I don't see her even for two or three days.

For a drunk man (about 20 years old) that I met one evening, and 
who behaved impudently with the girls standing by.

I felt it when on duty in the hospital I understood that I was 
not afraid to face death, that I also helped a little to relieve 
the pains of a patient.

Fear overwhelmed me when right against the car I was in I saw 
another one, as if out of control of the driver.

I felt it when a girl who was dear to me lied to my face. I got 
angry with the fact that she knew I didn't believe her but she 
kept on telling lies.
Sadness, no, I felt something much stronger when my father died.

I got disgusted with a man who was beating a woman in the street. 
I just happened to be there but I was abhorred by the rudness.
When I knew that my husband and I were going to have a child.

Two years ago I saw a film on the TV. Even now it makes me 
afraid.
When my husband stays late at a meeting and I have to be alone.
The loss of a person I loved very much.
Deception from a person I loved very much.

I was very happy when I got the message that I had been accepted 
as a student in medicine.

I felt something close to that when I saw that there was a man on 
the terrace of the flat.

I got angry when I learned how short a time we had to prepare for 
the term examinations.

I felt sad when my first boyfriend and I left each other. It was neither 
his fault nor mine.

I felt it today when the bus driver shouted rather indecent words 
at a man without any reason whatsoever.

When I learned that my parents were going abroad and leaving me 
alone for a few years.

I was at the seaside and my brother disappeared for a couple of 
hours.

Some time ago I was disgusted with the "cleanness" of the 
refectory of our institute.

When I was admitted to the Institute. I had problems with many 
people about my applying for this institute and I decided to 
prove that one can pass excellently without visiting any 
preparatory couse. That is - I proved what I could do on my own.

Once as a child I dreamed of a fire. Since that time I hadn't 
wanted to sleep in that bed and had feared the night darkness 
(and so it is now).

A chief was unjustly punished on an autumn brigade and the one 
who was really guilty kept silent. I stepped in front and told 
the truth. The guilty chief called me in after the roll-call and 
threatened me.

Years ago I fell in love for the first time. as natural for every 
school-girl I was day-dreaming. Later (after 3 years) we left 
each other. No one was to blame but I felt deep sadness. Even now 
I remember about it quite often.

It was at a comsomol(??) meeting, the last one because we were to 
graduate. The way one of my fellow-students behaved made me feel 
disgusted.

When I learned I was admitted to study what I wanted most - 
floriculture (this is a narrow specialization from the general 
one).

I was walking on the pavement when a white car rolled on it and 
directed towards me. I was quite near the house wall when it 
rolled by and hit me.

My grandmother's brother had taken active part in the resistance 
movement. He had been in prison many times and there he lost his 
health. He became an invalid. When we phoned to First Aid the 
nurse on duty behaved quite unkindly when she understood how old 
he was (79).

My boyfriend is a soldier. He was on a leave. I felt sad when we 
had to get separated again.

I felt disgusted about a teacher who had rejected all that was 
human in her. She refused to accept the flowers we gave her for 
the eighth of March and asked for a foreign parfume instead.

I was very glad when I learned I was a student already. I heard 
about it over the phone, I didn't believe it at first.
I had worries about a certain illness.

I suffered from a gynaecological illness. I was quite displeased 
to hear that my roommates had talked about it and they had 
misrepresented the truth. I felt deeply hurt when I learned that 
it was done by a "good" acquaintance of mine.

When my first boyfriend left me. I tried not to let him 
understand I felt miserable.

I hate hypocrisy. My friend (girl) tried to intrude into my 
affairs with my future husband. After that she behaved as if 
nothing had happened.

I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistry 
examination.

This was what I felt when my boyfriend went to Bourgas to study 
there. I had the feeling I would lose him. Anyway the distance 
Plovdiv-Bourgas seemed to me so great.

I confronted with this feeling at the Institute quite recently, 
the pedology lecturer was the cause.

This feeling was quite deep when my friend (girl) died in a car 
accident.

I am disgusted with the behavior of a car driver whose car would 
run over me and my friends during our autumn brigade.

I sensed a strong feeling of joy when in the plant, at my working 
place, I got a message that I was admitted as full time student at 
the Higher Agricultural Institute.

Fear when fulfilling my obligations on my first night fatigue 
duty as a soldier.

When on a car journey a fellow student crossed our way with his 
own car and we had to bump into a roadside trunk.
The loss of a close relative who was ill with cancer.

I am disgusted with a nieghbour who is looking for all sorts of 
quarrel with my parents and me. He feels we are hampering his 
living close to us. This has been going on for quite a long time.

After a difficult exam. When I had not hoped to take it and had 
got a high mark. When you present someone with something and he 
feels glad.

Fear from the unknown. I felt fear when I sat for the entrance 
examinations.

I feel angry at people's indifference at our ability to be 
present at an event and to stay partial to what happens.

When you are far away from relatives and friends. I feel sad for 
my early years, for the freedom and the carefree years of 
childhood.
I feel disgusted with the bootlickers, with helpless people.

I was sitting for an exam in biochemistry, I was very excited 
because it was a supplementary examination. I passed the exam 
very well and was glad because I recovered my selfconfidence.

Students fear many things but we seem to fear the examinations 
most of all. I remember I was horror stricken before my 
microbiology exam, because it was a decisive one.

It was necessary to organise a competition in connection with a 
celebration. Everyone was to be present at that event. It turned 
out that there was no audience at all because everyone had 
pretended to be very intelligent and no one had come. I got 
furious.

When I part with my friends I feel always sad for some time. I 
can't remember a concrete example now. For example I have just 
parted with a friend of mine and I am feeling sad.

In autumn I had to move to another lodging. My landlords, quite 
intelligent people, warned me I had to move in the nearest 
future. But I had difficulties in moving my luggage because I 
couldn't wait for a car to come. How amazed I was to hear them 
threatening me they would throw our my things. And at that my 
luggage was well packed and did not stand in their way. I was 
quite disappointed and disgusted.

When I succeded in establishing a contact with a girl (who is now 
my girlfriend).
I fear before each exam.
When my bosom friend tried to lie to me.
When I quarrelled with a very close friend of mine.
When I see the acts and deeds of a blind drunk man.

I feel joy usually after each taken exam, the last one was in 
February.

It was not long ago when I and two of friends of mine got quite drunk 
and one of them began to rave under the influence of the alcohol. 
I felt fear of what could have happened.

I felt anger at my last exam, I felt angry with our teacher, 
because he did not rate me objectively and I failed.

I met a girl some time ago and I cared very much about her but it 
happened so that we left each other. I felt some sort of sadness, I think 
I can call it so.

I had a very good friend (boy) and I thought I could rely on him 
but he behaved badly with a girl who used to trust us completely.
When I was admitted to the Higher Institute.

I felt fear when I fell down and broke my leg into pieces and I 
could not feel it at all.

I felt angry when I failed in an exam about which I knew quite a 
few things and I did not deserve to be plucked.

When my mother and father were on an excursion in Chechoslovakia 
and I was at a student camp and I heard over the radio about the 
events that were taking place there.

I felt disgust with alcohol in general when a close friend of 
mine got so drunk that he didn't realize what he was doing and it 
was quite shameful.

I felt joy when I was admitted to the Higher Agricultural 
Institute.

I feel fear quite often but this feeling was very strong last 
year when my husband was quite unexpectedly sent to the hospital.

That was what I felt with a teacher who put down quite unreal 
marks.

I felt sad when a friend of mine died and I felt that something 
had irrevocably gone away from me.

I felt disgust with a lady teacher who used to nag, to mock, to 
interrupt everyone of my fellow students each time we had a class 
with her in our first year.

I was for the first time on a brigade this year. At that time my 
sister was to bear a child. I was mad with joy when I opened the 
telegram from my parents and learned I had a nephew.

It was some years ago when one evening some people came home and 
told us my father was badly injured in an accident.

I faced this feeling when I realized I wasn't admitted to the 
institute in the first classifying, in spite of the high mark I 
had got at the entrance examination.

Always when I get separated from my friends and relatives from my 
home town.

I feel disgust with my first boyfriend who made fun of our love 
in an abominable way.

Naturally when I got myself discharged this was my second 
birthday.
When I failed my first exam at the Higher Institute.

A nuisance used to live in our flat a month ago. I experienced 
this feeling when I tried to chase her out.
After my father's death.
With an alcoholic.

I felt the greatest burst of joy when after being heavily ill for 
a long period, my father came back home.

I was terrified during an axcursion in Italy. I was lost and left 
alone in this unfamiliar country.

I took part in a football match. The referee was extremely 
partial to the opposite team. This stirred up my discontent and 
anger.
When my first girlfriend an I left each other.

During a summer holiday at a bar I happened to see a dead to the 
world woman.

When I got a message that I was employed as a nurse at a 
kindergarten.
When I first sat for an entrance examination.

When a teacher though pretending to be a highly cultivated 
teacher and a man, slapped a classmate of mine in the face quite 
undeservedly.
When I got separated from my first love.

Many times, when my father used to come home drunk and maltreated 
physically me and my mother.

Being invited out by a person I wished to get closer to. He 
telephoned and invited me to go out with him the next night.
Watching a horror movie with friends.

The breakup of a relationship. After the event I was upset/sad 
then angry maybe 2/3 weeks later.

The funeral of a friend who was killed in a car accident. She was 
of my own age, there were many of my own friends present, as well 
as her family etc.

Disgust for a person who treated me badly, and has treated other 
people similarly - including lying, hiding facts, being 
deceitful, unfair, etc.

Achievement of a task by a friend who had begun a new job. She 
wasn't confident of handling the situation so was thinking of 
leaving the job only after 2 days employment.

Walking home at night after university - part of the way, there 
are ano lights and I am walking down a thoroughfare with the 
thouth of no one hearing me if I have to scream.

When my son omits to carry out certain duties at home that he 
knows needs doing.

When I saw my niece (5 yrs) crying in the hallway for her mother 
who had passed away about a month ago.

With a woman who had walked into my place of employment and 
urinated on the floor in front of everyone.

Felt joy a few years ago when I was away on holiday. And sat very 
close to my best friend looking straight into the eyes.

I had to tell someone that I was interested in remaining celibate 
and alone. And that my spiritual master strictly prohibited 
sexual relations outside of marriage. This caused great fear 
through lack of conviction afraid to hurt someone's feelings 
despite my own being hurt in the process.

In a sociology class I felt very angry towards some members of 
society for exploiting the Polynesian people, dawn raids by 
Police (Martin Luther King, Blacks in S.A.). But this was just a 
reflection of my own shortcomings.

Felt sad about some street kids in QUEII square, Aotea square. 
Because they had been sniffing glue and some were very young. I 
went into the role of a performing clown.

I was disgusted by my paranoid attitude towards myself, my 
homework at university and disgusted about my lack of retention. 
Especially in learning another language.

When I meet old past pupils of mine - and find they are all doing 
well - I feel joy. Yesterday I met a young woman (20 yrs) I'd 
taught her at 6 yrs, then at 12 yrs and hadn't seen her for last 
3-4 yrs; she was no longer a waitress but a meter maid for 
Council.

A Maori language oral test, yeaterday - Although I had studied 
intensely - once in the examiners room "I blew it" - I was so 
nervous I couldn't reply easily - It was very important, but I 
got only blankness.

A friend visited and made comments that my house/garden were not 
as neat/tidy as in the past. I'd not seen her a year - She 
implied I'd gone to the pack (I'd only been working full time, 
and taking 3 University exams part time).

When my father a 4th/5th generation colonial (from Eng.) attacked 
me verbally about my chosen partner. A man whom he discarded 
because his colour skin was not white. His ultimate disgust 
saddned me.

People who came to our home - and requested "Put out your smoke". 
That we should not smoke in our house... and asked not even 
politely. It disgusted me because I think people need to adapt to 
the situation.
My 3 children - each top his class in the final exams 1984.

A truck (big one) nearly mowed me off the road (I was driving a 
small Lazer).

A shop in Downtown wouldn't accept my Visa Card - before December 
last year.

My dog of 16 and 1/2 years - "Lord Grey" died in his sleep - His 
death caused me more and deeper sadness than I thought.
A sour looking man was beating his thin dog in Remuera.
When my daughter was born.

When my mother entered surgery for a quadruple heart bypass. I 
felt intense fear at the time she was actually wheeled away.

When my husband got picked up in our new car for drunken driving. 
We had made a pact the other would not drink and so therefore 
would be the driver for the evening etc. I was not present at the 
time.
When my grandmother died very suddenly without warning.

When the N.Z. rugby union announced that they would proceed with 
a rugby tour of South Africa.

Being reunited with my family after not having seen them for 5 
years, at the airport. Sheer elation at getting through the 
"paper work" collecting bags and the anticipation of coming 
through the customs gate.

I caught a huge eel on a fishing line which I had pulled into the 
boat. I cut the line and threw the whole lot back into the water. 
Later that day and about ten miles away I went swimming and 
someone made the comment wondering how far eels could swim, I 
abruptly ended swimming for fear at an unseen eel for a few days 
until we had left the district.

My partner without discussing with me the situation decided it 
was time for us to have a break and went ahead and arranged his 
own life for the next 6-12 months, then told me the day before it 
was about to happen having been tolerant and friendly for the 
preceding week.

I had been living in an overseas city and made the decision to 
leave the city and come home about 12 months before I met a whole 
new set of friends, leaving them at the airport was sad and 
traumatic as they had helped me in many ways and I knew I 
wouldn't see many of them again.

After I had managed to fail my first year at University I was 
scared as to what I was going to do with my future. I didn't want 
a mundane 9-5 job and yet I didn't know if I could pay my way 
through an unsubsidized year at university to settle down and 
continue my studies.

This situation keeps occurring - when my little sister disagrees 
with me or vice-versa. We have very similar temperaments and I 
always end up feeling angry at her and myself for fighting so 
much over unimportant trivial matters.

When my grandmother, who has been living with us for 14 years, 
had a stroke and was left paralysed on one side. She has been 
quite close to our family and to see her suffer in this way makes 
me feel really sad.

A gathering of a social sports club at which they proceeded to 
show pornographic videos and then afterwards (when most people 
had had quite a bit to drink) carried on in a very degrading, 
unmoral manner - especially females exposing and flaunting 
themselves with no shame or embarassment.

My mother along with some of my friends gave me a surprise 
birthday party - they invited a large number of my friends along 
too.

My mother did not come home till late at night (Ages ago). Anyway 
if I don't know where my parents are and when they'll be back I 
start thinking that perhaps they have had an accident and are 
perhaps dead.

Because I am the Captain of a basketball team I usually organise 
a roster system so that everyone in the team can have a turn at 
doing either a duty or a ref. A lot of the time the girls can't 
be bothered or just forget - I usually have to fill in.

So as to be closer to the university I have left home and moved 
into Auckland. It now seems as if I have left home - especially 
my family - forever.

A friend of mine goes out with this guy. She sleeps with him but 
is quite happy for him to play around - as well as herself.

Passing my pharmacy exams which meant my tertiary education for 
pharmacy completed.

When I was in a car with my parents and friends and we had to 
back up (reverse) pass a river which when I recall it (I was only 
about 5 yrs) seemed we were going to fall in and drown.

When my boyfriend wouldn't dance with me on my graduation night 
because he thought I could dance with my friends who were 
friendly.

When my sister (really my niece) died of cancer at the age of 2 
yrs after I took her to the doctor at the age of 1 and he 
diagnosed it.

My brother gave me a beating because he could not beat me 
verbally.

Joy for me is when all my family gather around home for special 
occasions as Christmas etc. It really gives me joy to see my 
family and relatives and to observe natures productivity process 
which have been going on for centuries.

I had this experience of fear when few people were fighting at a 
social one night, which one of my relative was involved. My fear 
was greatly for him because he was being assaulted badly.
Never really had the experience just yet - N/A.

This occurred when my girlfriend and I have to finish our 
relationship due to some circumstances between her and her 
family. I was really sad, hurt and couldn't really find any 
reason why am I still living. Is this life is all about ? This 
was one of few question which crept up vividly every time I 
thought about what had happened.

I'm very disgusted when I see people abusing their body with 
drugs and alcohol. They take advantage of these things usually 
for an excuse for the fantasies which they like and so they do 
things stupidly and unjustly.
Letting Jesus take control of my emotions i.e., ill feeling.
Had fear of losing husband.

When present boyfriend's mother approached my parents and self - 
to leave her son alone - as she did not want me for a future 
daughter-in-law.
When boyfriend could not stand up to his mother or for himself.

Disgusted with boyfriend's mother - her overpowering, 
over-protecting and selfish attitudes.

My cousin asked me to be a bridesmaid for her. This made really 
happy because I was adopted into the family and her asking me 
made me realise that she saw me as a cousin and not just another 
person. There were other cousins she could have asked but she 
asked me.

That if ever I was really naughty I would be sent away from my 
Mum and Dad to another family. I was fostered from age 5 and 
didn't get to Mum and Dad until I was 6 and then legally adopted 
at 14.

(1) My father died. (2) My natural father contacted me a year 
after my father died and this angered me more as I thought he 
should be dead and not my father.

My father died. I was away at the time and did not know until two 
days after.

A child told me she had been sexually abused by her step-father. 
I only knew the child and had not come into contact with either 
parent. I tried to do what was best for the child. The event and 
the stepfather disgusted me.
Joy at meeting a woman I love very much.
When approached by a gang of youths in town at night.

When a man, a stranger to me, personally insulted a close woman 
friend of mine in public.
After my father died suddenly of a heart attack.

When a man spoke very sexistly in the company of some friends of 
mine.

When my lover and I felt like we had gone full circle. And our 
relationship was new, fresh, vital etc. once again.

My daughter was 2 yrs she went up to a colt tried to hit it. It 
turned on her and kicked her over the heart, sent her flying 
through the air. I left my mother and sister to deal to her as 
they are nurses. I felt I didn't want to know if she was going to 
die, it was just too much.
My anger is with men, their inability to be human (not all men).

The saddest I've ever been was when my lover was killed, 
hitch-hiking to work.

With the N.Z. Rugby Union wanting to send the All Blacks to South 
Africa.

A good friend, the wife of the vicar of my church came up to me 
from the pews (I am in the choir) and shook my hand during the 
time for an informal "greeting" in the church service. She said a 
few words.

I walked up the main street of Auckland at 10 o'clock at night. I 
expected it to be very active with people, gangs, fast cars etc, 
thought it was actually quite quiet, though also oppressive. I 
walked about half a mile and bought a drink along the way.

Someone in my family (my brother I suspected) ate a bun which I 
had made for myself. It was during a long telephone call after I 
had just made it and put it in the oven warming drawer.

Sitting in a bus, I heard behind, the voice of a girl I was 
friendly with. After her talking for some time with another girl 
I decided it wasn't her in fact that someone miming her, which it 
was when I finally looked. I was talking to a friend at the time.

Having moved into a flat within the last week I felt some disgust 
that a bathroom tap had been left to drip with a faulty fawcet.

My friend replying to my letter and again saying he was attracted 
to me and suggesting we write, talk and get together and see how 
things went and his suggestion that I could ring and doing that it 
was really good - though really insane conversation.

Being sexually assaulted (not rape, but passionate kissing) by a 
friend's father - he stopped when he was driving me home. I 
hadn't wanted the lift, had refused 3 times, and then felt it'd 
be rude to refuse again. Was really afraid of what he might do.

I live by myself and a few weeks ago was woke by a man on the end 
of my bed coming up my bed at me. I was really angry, told him to 
get out. He was surprised, hesitated; I started to move towards 
him and he backed off - kept telling him - loudly, but firmly to 
go. Because I'd got the initiative, I succeeded. A very powerful 
message.

When my grandmother died - I wasn't sad so much that she'd died 
because she was old, but because she lived in the last few years 
in an old people's home and had nothing very much that was hers - 
no chair, or private space, and when I went to visit she would be 
sitting in the "lliving" room the TV room. It was hopeless. And I 
felt awkward so I didn't go and I was sad 'cos how I couldn't.

When during a social evening with my father, brother, sister, 
close friend and my father's 2nd wife - I had an argument with my 
father, who abused my friend who was sticking up for me.

When the girl whom I have lusted after expressed reciprocal 
feelings and then days later changed her mind.
When a close friend wilfully cheated me.

Girlfriend arriving back from overseas and picking her up from 
airport. When she finally appeared from customs and we came in 
contact again.

Fear of punishment for having broken an item of value to my 
parents.

That a friend had been badly beaten and stabbed many times and 
the person that did it got away without any punishment from the 
law.
The death of an animal we had reared.

Finding that a girlfriend of mine was a prostitute and had been 
seeing many others during our relationship.

The feeling of joy when again I had confessed my sin and 
experienced God's forgiving grace and cleansing power - total 
enlightenment and freedome - bliss.

Riding through a bush fire on an island of Australia - on a 
pushbike as a little boy - all alone, lost and surrounded by 
smouldering wood and flame.

When bicycling along, a courier van started to tail me very close 
- I sped up and moved over and he just did the same. I reacted 
violently, much physical responding in the dangerous situation.

My cat was sick and I had to take him to the vet to be put down - 
no one else there to do it.

When someone I had had a relationship (purely sexual) with came 
up to me after I had used her and acted as if nothing had 
changed.

First time I slept with my present girlfriend. Had been best 
friends for a year but had been hesitant about getting involved 
emotionally.

Waiting for a taxi - when within 1/2 an hour two separate people 
challenged me to fight for no apparent reason except they were 
drunk.

Deliberately provoked by someone close. Angered by the 
deliberation not the provocation.

My girlfriend let me down badly 3 times in one week. These 
instances summed up all the negative aspects of our relationship 
which at the time seemed doomed to fail.
A close friend took part in a racist violent action.

Hearing that I had been successful in getting a position whereby 
my financial, physical, spiritual and emotional needs will be 
well catered for. This position fulfils a lot of my aims for the 
last five years of my life.

When I decided to leave my steady, secure employment to come to 
university. Because I didn't know if I could cope with all the 
requirements of study and also being older I didn't know if I 
would enjoy mixing with younger people, also financial 
insecurity.

When a close friend failed to live up to the expectations I had 
of him - thereby causing pain to his spouse. I believe that my 
anger was probably a reaction of fear that I wouldn't be able to 
live up to my own expectations.

Departure of a very close friend - for a long stay overseas, 
sharing in the sorrow of her parents who were left behind.

I get disgusted with the inherent racist attitudes of my 
brother-in-law in putting down various ethnic groups and also my 
unwillingness to challenge him about these attitudes in order to 
keep the peace.
Hearing Fran Wilde introduce the Bill.

Being harrassed for being gay; suggestions of being physically 
beaten - acting as informal bouncer in a gay bar.
Landlord putting up rents sneakly and slimily.

Listening and watching a tape of someone with AIDS being 
prejudiced against at a counselling course on AIDS with 20 
others.

Hearing Norman Jones get hysterical in Parliament about law 
reform (on the radio - listening with 2 others).
Won a prize for effort.
Assaulted by drunken neighbour.

I was playing in a football tournament and saw the rules openly 
disregarded.
Death of brother.
Reading literature on AIDS/homosexuality.

I was feeling really low - had been a series of fights with my 
siblings, been under pressure at school and wasn't going to the 
party I wanted to go - instead I was going out with my family. A 
guy called and said, in effect, that I was "nice" and he liked 
me. Hence the emotional joy.

I was watching a movie alone - it was a horror movie. The music 
was a deep pulsing type - not really music. And a light flashed 
on and off. It was in the complete darkness of a movie theatre 
that was almost empty.

My sister and I were fighting as usual. She's older tham I am, 
bigger built and stronger I couldn't win in a physical battle and 
in a verbal battle I couldn't seem to get through to her to 
really hurt her.

My paternal grandmother had died. We weren't close but she was 
blood. I didn't cry but I was sad, partly due to her death and 
partly I think, due to the fact that I couldn't/didn't cry.

My older sister used to pick on my brothers and sisters all of 
whom were younger than her. On one occasion my brother did 
something my sister didn't like. A full-scale battle began.

Winning a rowing race at a Karapiro regatta. With 7 other 
friends.

Being alone in Europe and having to catch a train and bus to the 
airport, then board the plane alone.

At school teacher for not allowing us to go out on New Year's Eve 
when on a class trip overseas.

I was in a car accident on the way back from a weekend rowing 
regatta we'd won. 5 others were in the car. I thought I'd never 
be able to row again.
Our boarder burping after meals !

When I won a position on the track-team for the trans-tasman 
games when I was eleven.
When I was jumped by three men in a deserted area.

Once a person in authority (school teacher) was telling blatant 
lies about me and the headmistress would not let me defend 
myself. She was also telling lies about other members of my 
family.
When my mother died.

When somebody who had been a bully and had acted cruelly to 
others who were unable to defend themselves was taken down a few 
notches and he began to grovel. I was disgusted with his 
grovelling and the manner in which he had treated others.
Easter holiday - I had been working weekends and had just left.
Haven't been frightened for ages.

I visited a special education school. The headmaster applied a 
policy of strict positive - negative reinforcement to the 
children involved. Children who measured up to his standards were 
made a fuss of - children who didn't were ignored.

I felt sad with the two situations I described before. The cat 
and the school. Sadness was intermingled with the other feelings.

Next door nieghbour ran over his cat in driveway, he tried to 
finish it off with a flat shovel. I would have taken cat to 
veterinary to either kill humanely or cure.

Getting my kitten, found at work several years ago, taking him 
home in a box on my motorbike, showing it to my defacto.
Obscene phone call where the person knew my name.
At work being shifted to another area.

Enrolling at varsity, being told I couldn't get in to certain 
papers.
Noticing my flat had maggotts !

When I was finally able to return to a job that I enjoyed doing 
after several months absence (I was not needed during this time).
When I was attacked by a teenage boy and had my wallet stolen.

Someone who was speeding was forced to slow down when I pulled 
out onto the road and proceeded to abuse me at the next set of 
traffic lights.

When someone I was close to became a paranoid schizophrenic and I 
was unable to see this person because of the situation.

When someone whom I considered my friend, without telling me he 
was annoyed, proceeded to ignore me for several meets with no 
apparent reason.

At my wedding - standing with the man I love and acknowledging 
that fact to members of family and friends.

As a result of breaking the indicator light as mentioned 
for guilt.

Arriving home from work after a long and tiring day to find no 
dinner prepared as I had expected.

At the death of my husband's father's mother which occurred 
during university examinations and therefore I was unable to 
attend her funeral.

With a Manager who insists on making crude innuendos pertaining 
to sex.
Waking in morning (early morning) and having whole day to myself.

Being driven by friend who suddenly swerved and skidded a little. 
It was night and on a long trip. We ended up on side of road.

Friend (male) hinted that my talking to other men at a pub was 
immoral. He implied that I should remain only with my boyfriend 
the entire evening.
On rising. No apparent reason.

Prolonged "niggling" of friend on a single theme which I 
considered of no consequence.
When my first niece was born.

In a flat in Sydney - rough area at home on my own - the flat had 
been burgled the night before and no way of locking the door.
When the bus driver failed to stop and pick me up at a bus stop.
When my uncle died of leukemia at age 35.

Watching an alcoholic woman who was approaching everyone at the 
wharf for cigarettes - a prostitute in Auckland (elderly).

When I went to the pub with a large group of friends, we drank 
and danced.
Watched a horror movie which involved sexual attacks on women.

My boyfriend promised to take me to see a game of tennis and rang 
saying he was going to the pub with some of his friends instead.

My mother was unwell and went for many cancer tests. She spent 
time in hospital being opened and closed many times.

I was driving along and saw this young guy urinating into the 
gutter, in broad daylight.
Birth of children.
Being alone at night.
In a hurry to get to lectures and the car would not start.
When grandfather died.
Obscene phone calls.
Thought had discovered true love.

Stopped at lights in Mangere late one Friday night on way home 
from work. Alone in car when someone came up behind the car and 
started banging and shaking it. Light was red and had nowhere to 
go until light changed. When green I took off.

When fired unjustly from a job as casual bar-person. Charged with 
giving away free drinks. Not done so and had witnesses to prove 
it - both patrons and bar staff. Other staff were supportive.

Close friend leave to go overseas for an indefinite period. 
Farewell scene at airport.
When employer made a pass at me whilst I was at work.

Receiving understanding from within self of a subject I had 
previously wished to understand better.

To talk in a meeting - expound my thoughts on a subject. Fear 
delayed me acting to do this.

Towards wife's laziness in not performing her usual duties 
because of television watching.
Watching suffering in Third World country.

Observation of people lost in the profit motive - i.e. business 
managers to their actions esp.

Meeting best friend at the airport (boyfriend) who I had missed 
terribly.

Confronted outside a party by some very nasty character - 
gesturing to a car full of mean-acting friends - felt in danger.
NO RESPONSE.
My cat died painfully and slowly.

Having unwanted attention paid to me in my place of work - 
harrassment (and sexual harrassment) by another worker - 
disgusted by his implications.

I was very pleased and happy when my older sister came home from 
living somewhere out of town and I hadn't seen her for months. We 
are very close sisters.

I was skiing alone and the mountain became covered with mist and 
I thought I was lost and was going to panic.

My parents didn't allow me to go to a social function that all my 
friends were attending.

While still at school a friend died of cancer, after being ill 
for a long time, she was 17 yrs old.

At a party my best girlfriend got really drunk and went off with 
a guy she knows I really like.

When my brother who has been out of New Zealand for 10 years came 
to visit with his wife which none of our family had previously 
met.

When I had to give a speech about some historical event, to an 
audiece of about 200 people my own age whom I did not know.

In arguments with a close friend or relative where my point of 
view is completely disregarded.

When my grandfather whom I had met only once for 3 weeks, died 
after several months. I was really sad because he was a lovely 
person and I did not have the means for his company.

I once saw a programme on TV describing how certain wild life 
films were made and was disgusted by the treatment of certain 
animals in this particular programme of the polar bear.

When my former boyfriend and I reconciled and he decided that I 
was very important to him. I had always wanted us to get back 
together again, but had doubted the likelihood of this, so I was 
very happy when my small amount of faith was vindicated.

When riding in a very fastly-driven car on a lose metal road at a 
very late hour - no other cars on road, and driver was taking 
corners very sharply. I felt afraid - because if an accident 
happened, the area was very isolated. Also, I feared for driver, 
after I was dropped off - would he make it home safely.

When at very short notice I agreed to work in place of a friend 
who was sick, and owner of the restaurant refused to allow me a 
drink later in the evening (which is usually always available for 
workers), did not thank me, and was generally indifferent towards 
me - I felt I did not deserve this.

When I learned that my former boyfriend had become engaged - 
although I was glad that he had found what he wanted, I was very 
sad at my own personal loss, since I had always hoped we might 
one day reconcile.

When reading a newspaper story of a man who had committed 
incestuous acts on his two-year old child - the thought that 
anyone could do such a thing is abhorrent to me.

I did a solo flight from Ardmore to Kaikohe before I got my pilot 
licence. I can remember it was gorgeous day and I was on a 
natural high, cruising up the coast with my maps and compasses 
and gear. Other pilots had seen me off and wished me good luck 
and it was a real adventure.

A friend (female) and I were on holiday on Great Barrier Island 
by ourselves. One night we were nearly raped by about 20 locals - 
they came to our bach and tried to break the doors down. All of 
them were stoned or drunk and we hid under the bunks and were 
totally terrified. Eventually these guys gave up and went looking 
for us on the beach. We escaped and slept in the bush for 2 
nights.

I "cooked" the engine in my father's car - it was actually his 
fault because he hadn't fixed the temperature gauge or told me. 
When I finally got home I was absolutely screamed at and the 
anger I experienced was over the injustice of it all plus the 
huge row which developed.

This sounds really predictable and usual but it was absolutely 
heart-rending at the time. My first lover (I was 15) just rang up 
one day and announced that he had found another woman. I never 
saw him again and it hurt because I was positive that it was 
"TRUE LOVE" !!

I once saw an old man up the road, fossicking through the rubbish 
bins and the gutter. I was really disgusted at first but I've 
seen him a few times since then and now I feel really sorry for 
him and I often give him cigarettes when I see him, because he 
mainly goes after cigarette butts and it is revolting.

A holiday at a whitesand deserted beach. A cool evening near the 
end of summer and we had a fire in the sand - toasted 
marshmellows, cuddled and drank champagne.

Skiing down a very icy slope, very fast in white-out conditions. 
Out of control with no idea of what I was doing or where I was 
heading.

My best friend at school told lies about me to a boy I was seeing 
and went out with him herself.

I found a baby opposum on the road and took it home and cared for 
it for a week. It had to be force-fed and carried in a fur pouch 
under my jersey. My father had the vet put it to sleep as he said 
they carried diseases.

A boyfriend with whom I split up with came over to a friend's 
house where I was visiting with a male friend. In a confrontation 
in another room he tried to find out if I was aroused by my 
friend by feeling my parts.

Winning a race that I had been training for, for many weeks. 
(Running Race).

When I was very young and we moved as a family to Auckland from 
Wellington, this meant new school and friends (etc.).

When someone ignores what I am saying or doesn't let me have my 
point of view and they monopolise a conversation.

When I got into an argument with someone and was very abusive, 
but they were a close friend and I later regretted it.

When a close relative got quite drunk. It was a relative that I 
had respected for a long time and looked up to as a child.

Listening to the opening bars of Tchaikovsdy's symphony No.2 
fourth movement at my sister's wedding.

As a passenger in a vehicle travelling from the steep side of 
Arthur's Pass in the middle of a sleet-storm, icy roads, sheer 
chasms to one side, sheer face to the other.
As in sadness (A), relating to this slaghter of fur-seals.

A) A documentary in which baby fur seals were being 
clubbed/spiked to death by Canadian seal-hunters. Brutally 
graphic.
B) Description of a disfigured orphaned child in Hiroshima 
calling for her mother.

The repression of rioting and non-rioting "Blacks" in South 
Africa by the police of that "Democracy".

Seeing my sister after about 2 years of not seeing her. Only 
spent 1 hour or so before she was off overseas with her husband 
for 3 months.

I imagined I heard footsteps up the hall while sleeping in bed 
one night by myself in the house.

Stopped at a Fast Food shop with friends and a few locals wanted 
to fight us for no apparent reason. They hit and picked on one of 
my friends.

My father recently having a heart attack - spending a few months 
in hospital.

My flatmate and close friend living and sleeping with another 
close friend of mine.
Talking with someone I admire a lot.
Held under water by a large wave and thought I was drowning.

Came back from surfing to find car broken into and gear and money 
stolen.
Caused a family disturbance.
Friends calling me fat - pear shaped in front of a nice girl.
I was "best man" at my brother's wedding a year ago.
Mugged while on holiday in the U.S.A.

I am one of four directors of a company. We inherited land held 
by our family - ours is the 5th generation. A "democratic" 
decision was made to stap-bank an area of mangroves.

Social situation - at the pub - a close friend of 2 years told 
the group around us of advances I had made.

A drunk walked out in front of a car at night. Both lower legs 
were broken. His shoe was thrown about 50 yards after the 
accident.
Hearing my girlfriend accept my offer of marriage.
Canoeing across harbour in winds - 20 knots and rising seas.

Brother continually interupting while I was talking on the 
telephone.
Hearing of the death of a friend who had been skiing.

Flicking through a magazine showing pictures of homosexual men 
committing various acts.
When I found out I had passed all of my university exams.

Almost crashing into the back of a car while driving along the 
motorway on my motorcycle.
When my girlfriend of two years told me it was all over.

A person I really like left for overseas for a few months, I had 
hoped to go out with her soon.

I deliberately avoided a person who I wanted to hurt, and who 
wanted to talk to me.

When I received my U.E. accredited as I was totally unexpecting 
it and I was so happy.

I went to see a movie and I went with a friend, it was really 
frightening and it made me stop and think about the world around 
me and what it is really like out there. I was frightened all 
that night.

When my flatmate put me down because she "thought" she was better 
than me, or she felt she was.

When a very close friend of mine went into hospital for a major 
operation and I couldn't see her for a while as I was not a 
relative she had no relatives in N.Z.

One of my very good friends came to me for advice as her 
boyfriend had been hitting her and beating her quite harmfully.
I received an assignment back, and got an A+ grading.

I was walking home one night (after getting a bus to my town) 
when I was confronted by a group of males (about 6), they would 
not let me pass - they made comments etc. - I crossed the road 
and hurried home.

I lent a text-book to a person I did not know very well, they 
lost the text-book and gave me no compensation.

At the beginning of the year I moved to a new city - I felt sad 
as I had to leave many friends and family members behind.

I read a newspaper article about dogs being stolen in order to 
use them for fighting purposes.

Getting University Entrance accredited and arriving home from 
boarding school on accrediting leave.

Thinking that I had been seen smoking at school by a teacher - 
waiting to be summoned to the headmaster's office.

When my mother rejected my boyfriend and made unfair judgements 
on him.

At my grandfather's funeral - My grandparents virtually raised me 
as my mother was a solo-parent and had to work.
Watching a TV documentary on seal clubbing.
The birth of my first child.

A large german shepherd dog ran and barked at me (he didn't bite 
fortunately).

Most recently when the chairman at the New Zeeland Rugby Union 
announced that the All Blacks' would accept the invitation of 
South Africa to play rugby in that country.

When I was told a friend's baby had been born with only partial 
sight. This was her first child and she was not young (the mother 
that is).

When I first saw the state of a cafeteria in the grounds of the 
university. Due to students own lack of concern for the 
environment in which they eat and drink. Rubbish and spilled tea 
and coffee left everywhere.

I was biking with my boyfriend, the sun shining after a long 
period of bad beather, afterwards we spent the evening and night 
together.

I was hitchhiking and was picked up by a stranger he drove into 
the woods and wanted to make love with me, I refused and escaped 
from the car. When walking in the wood and hearing the car I was 
afraid.

In a discussion the leader wanted to stop because she was of the 
opinion that we were not involved and she misjudged our reactions 
as negative. We however only posed several questions which she 
couldn't answer.

When my grandmother died. She stayed with us until I had the age 
of 10. When she died I was 13 and I remember the moment after the 
funeral: I sat on the table and cried.
When I heard about the disaster in Bophal (India).
When passing the final examinations for social worker.

Sleeping alone in a tent, while hearing several noises such as 
rustling etc, I am afraid that there are people who are up to no 
good.

A man kept a seat taken by putting his coat on it after a while 
the chair was still empty, I asked him if I could use the chair, 
he didn't agree for the chair was for his coat.
When the relationship with my girlfriend broke up.

A piece of work was marked as bad by the teachers I and some 
fellow students didn't agree with their vague criticism. I felt 
myself taken in by the teachers and felt disgust.

A friend came to tell me that her father invited me to go on 
holiday with them in Benidorm otherwise I could not afford to go 
on holiday.

At the age of 12 years I always had to take care of my little 
brother and sister I never could sleep then. I always imagined 
creepy men sneaking into our house.

The landlord had selected a new lodger on her own, while we used 
to do that it was not what she had done, but how she did it that 
made me angry.

It was a complex situation concerning a relationship with a 
boyfriend, I had broken the relationship for some reasons. 
Meanwhile, as I felt it, I had most sorrow.

At the moment when I heard the result of an examination and it 
proved that I succeeded the second year of my study.

I have a fobic anxiety for elevators. This anxiety is worst at 
the moment when the doors have to open. I have it often in the 
elevator at our university.

When someone accuses me without reason and is not willing to 
listen to me.
My boyfriend decided to make an end to our relationship.

A person I know who tells lies and so pretending to be better 
than she is.

I can't give one description here. I often feel joyful when I 
have done things good in relation to other people especially when 
my friend says he loves me and I also tell him that I love him.

I was afraid when my first boyfriend threatened to make an end to 
our relationship because he didn't love me enough while I loved 
him very much.

A good friend deceived me. Because of that little quarrel our 
relationship finished, mainly because she was not honest. I was 
very angry about that.
I was very sad when my first boyfriend finished our relationship.

I was once raped (one year ago) by a man who was a lot older than 
me and whom I just met. Maybe it wasn't rape but the man wanted 
more than I wanted to give him since there were other people in 
vicinity.
When my boyfriend came back after being away for 10 days.
When I was sitting in a car next to a man who was masturbating.

When my mother told things to my sister, which I told my mother 
in confindence.

Tonight in bed when I realised how bad my relationship with my 
friend was.

When I was in Eindhoven on an Exhibition of Hernan Nitsche, who 
made paintings with real blood. There were also photographs about 
the killing of cows.

When I was making music together with my friend. It sounded very 
good and we were very satisfied.

When my cat ran under a car and came home wounded. He could 
hardly walk. I didn't dare to go to a veterinarian because I was 
afraid he would kill him.

I had to unscrew something on my car. I didn't succeed after two 
afternoons of trying. A feeling of anger built up itself.

Losing my girlfriend who made an end to our relationship. By this 
I lost an important source of support, certainty and joyful 
moments. I cried very intensly when that happened.

A few days ago I saw two dandy girls of my age. I disliked their 
clothes and their way of doing.

At an important moment in a volleyball game we made a point and 
by this we won a set from a much stronger competitor.

When I went out with my dog in a forest late at night when we 
were on a camping.

I had an appointment with someone at a certain time. The other 
person didn't appear.

When I entered the operation theatre and underwent a difficult 
operation.

When my friends left without waiting for me, after we had arranged 
to go out together.
When they gave away my dog to other people without my knowledge.
When I had to eat scraps from a dust-bin, because of a bet.

When the Real Madrid team of basket ball qualified for the final 
of the Europe Cup at Athens.
On the scenic railway at the fairground.
At having an argument with a stranger, in the street.
When I entered a toilet in a bar and it stank.
The day I finished my military service.

When I was a child, one day, I was going home late at night and I 
did not notice an uncovered man hole and fell in it. I was in there for 
several minutes.
One day, when I was a child, my grandmother shut me up in a room.
The day I left my first girlfriend.

One day I was in the countryside with several friends, and we 
began to eat figs, after we were all full we noticed that all the 
figs were full of worms.
When I won the first prize in a cross country race.

I found myself involved in a fight in which a person died and I 
had to intervene with some risk.

An argument among friends in which my opinions on the way to 
spend spare time were disapproved.
I was forced to leave an unforgettable friend.

I saw the gare of a prison. This gare and the building were in 
deplorable condition and were full of rubbish.
When I passed the last exam, which I had doudts about.
Before I had a tooth pulled out. I was very upset and ill.

When the Real Madrid football team lost against the inter in the 
U.E.F.A cup.

When my dog died. I had reared it for nearly three years. It 
had been ill for several days and had not eaten anything. One 
morning I found it dead.

On a trip to Santander a child sitting beside me fell ill and 
started to vomit, seeing this made me feel very bad.

When I was back home after a long time, meeting beloved people 
and close friends.

When I heard about the treatment of a friend in jail. Really 
inhuman. I never realised that such things also happen in the 
Netherlands.

When on holiday in Greece I called my best friend, she told me 
she passed the examinations and that she had been admitted to the 
study for speech therapy.

Together with a little brother I biked on a lonely road in the 
Polder. Then we were annoyed by a boy on a motorbike: he 
took over, stopped, took over, etc. Then we saw he had something 
in his hand, we turned until we came across a man, who 
accompanied us.

We lived with 3 persons in the loft of a house. It often occurred 
that other persons again and again climbed the stairs with much 
noise. When I was studying I couldn't concentrate and got angry.

I partly colored my hair black. My mother didn't like it and 
reproached me to be a "subversive element". Later on she stated 
that this was due to my friends. As I see it, this all resulted 
from colouring my hair.

I was shopping in Utrecht with friends, we also ate some chips 
and snacks in a snackbar, then we saw a shabby fellow. He took a 
cold half eaten croquette (a snack) from a rubbish bin and eat 
it.

It appeared that I gave correct answers to all questions during 
an examination of personality while I thought I performed very 
badly. Even now, I don't know how I managed it.

My father was very angry with me, and I locked me up in the 
shower. Then my father knocked his fist through the door, I was 
scared to death.

My sister borrowed some LP records for a party. She had left them 
in the car on curatao. Due to the heat they were crooked, so I 
couldn't play them again.

When my grandmother died, her life was heavy and her last hours 
were terrible.

When I watched TV and saw a performance of "Prince" (a popidol). 
Disgusting he'd better be a stallion.

Unofficially I was informed about my results of the final 
examination of the secondary school. A teacher wrote them up for 
me. When I went outside, I started crying with joy.

I am thinking about death, the eternal of it, the unknown, the 
sense of being here. Often, laying in bed in the dark and quiet, 
the fear makes me feel dizzy.

If they force me to eat something I don't like. For example, my 
parents always twaddle and whine, when I don't eat all the food.

I had to leave Den Helder and all friends and acquaintences, 
after having spend two weeks there with my friends.

Being on view in a meat-factory. Pigs being cut open, pigs being 
suspended from nods, blood everywhere, decompsition.

When the parents of my girlfriend gave permission to spend our 
holiday together.

When the relationship with my first girlfriend broke up and I 
realized it too late.

Someone who always took care for the key of the sportshall stayed 
away without letting us know. Next time he did as if nothing had 
happened.
When my last relation broke up.

When working in a chemical laundry, I saw rats and maggots in the 
washing.
When I passed the driving test (on the second try).

I was walking in the wood at night with my boyfriend. Very 
romantic. Suddenly I heard a car driving very slowly with the 
lights out, it looked as if they were looking for something.

I am a teacher in arts and crafts (boys from 15-16 years). for 
them it is obligatory and they dislike it. They tease me. When one of 
them cut up some material I flared up.

My sister was in coma for 3 months (due to a train accident). Now 
her brainfunctions are disturbed. She will never be able to walk 
and she can hardly talk.

I lived together with my boyfriend. One night he stayed away and 
next day he told me that he had chat up with another girl.

When I started a relation with a girl, with whom I have fallen in 
love already some time ago.

Once sitting in the cinema, I became very anxious (watching a 
"cold" film). I do not know the reason.

I work for a journal. Once the lay-out came to nothing, due to 
thoughtlessness of some colleagues.

My mother was stuck by an apoplectic fit, was hemi-paralyzed and 
suffered an aphasia.

Each time I am confronted with reports about repression and 
torture.

I felt very happy when I heard I had passed the examination to 
move up to the second year course.

On a holiday in France I made a walk in the woods all alone and 
very relaxed. Then a motorbike took me over and I saw the man 
watching all the time. Suddenly the man stood behing me and I ran 
away fast.

I invited two friends. We should go out together. Those two girls 
kept talking about boys, chatting up etc. I bacame sick of it.

I felt very sad when my boyfriend wanted to break our 
relationship. Our relationship lasted two years, we shared 
everything and all this was finished.

I broke an egg, with which there was something wrong, into a 
little cup. There was a thick white "wad" in it. I tried to take 
it out and throw it in the sink.

I liked to see off my aunt (from Zaire) to the airport. That 
appeared to be impossible because I had to go to school. For long 
time I wasn't sure if I could accompany her. Two days before the 
departure they told me I was allowed to miss school.

I went to the ballet lessons with a little friend in the dark. On 
a very quiet place a boy approached us from behind and asked at 
what time the lesson would be finished. I gave him an avoiding 
answer, he took me up and wanted to run away with me.

I was sleeping nicely until in the middle of the night when I became 
awake because a friend called me for some (in my opinion) 
nonsens reason.

My boyfriend with whom I had a longlasting relationship, fell in 
love with another girl, then he asked me something which implied 
that he loved that girl more than he loved me.

On school, during a fancy fair, there was a stand of amnesty 
international. There I read (for the first time) a description of 
the tortures of a woman, what they did to her.

When I had to undergo the final examination of secondary school, 
I lived together with a girlfriend. We both were afraid to fail, 
but it appeard that we both had passed.

When I had left my home, my father, under false pretences, got me 
in his car and drove home where we were all alone. He was seethed 
with rage because I withrew from his authority. He hit me, kicked 
me and threatened me.

When my father took away my cherised diaries to burn them (I was 
also very sad) "Oh, how I hated him".

I felt very sad when I left home because I could not stand it any 
longer. I do not regret it, but I missed my little sister very 
much (and she missed me). These feelings wear off over time.

A friend and a girlfriend went to Rome for 10 days with their 
class. When they were back home I heard people tell "strange" 
stories about my friend and that girlfriend.
Passing my driver's examination (after two failures).

When I was six years old we were on holiday in France. There was 
very heavy weather then.

A quarrel with my mother because I thought she said very 
unreasonable things about me, that hit me strongly.

The disease and subsequent death of a close acquaintance. Sadness 
was accompanied with feelings of powerlessness (I also 
experienced sadness in the situation described under guilt).

When I take a look into a slaughter-house and when listening to 
stories about torturing people or animals.

When a friend of mine had her period, while thinking she was 
pregnant.
Fear to come and live in Nijmegen.
When the coach of our team degraded me to the second team.
When a friend died.

When I saw a documentary film about World War II (about Hitler 
and his adepts).

Spending the nitht with close friends, after being away (out of 
Nijmegen) for a while.

Just before I started my study I had to move, I was very afraid 
to be left alone and that I could not manage it.

When anybody wants to make me feel guilty. For example: I should 
do something for my mother, but things didn't go as she hoped. 
Then she threatens: I'll do it myself.

When a close friend took leave of me, because she went to Israel 
for one year.

I wanted to take something from under my bed. While doing this I 
felt a dead bird laying under my bed.

A fellow player, quite unexpectedly, scores a goal, which means a 
draw.

In college, I started a discussion with the teacher referring to 
a question I posed. I felt very unsure and I was afraid to fail.

While playing indoor-hockey, there always is an older man who 
frequently and intentionally plays the ball out of the field. In 
my opinion this is very childish, because we play for fun only.

I was together with my family one night, a few days after my 
father had died, during that conversation I expressed my 
displeasure because nobody understands me.

Salo, a movie film by Pasolini. People were misused and tortured 
for the fun of a few elder Italian authorities, during World War 
II.

When my boyfriend once again told me that he loved me after a 
period in which he felt very depressive.

I was walking alone in the street late at night (2.30 am). It was 
very quiet. Then a man approached me and said "Hello".
When, late at night, I discovered that they had stolen my bike.

When a friend, after being free of drugs for half a year, started 
using them again.
In a disco, there was a dirty little chap who punched my bottom.

When a friend who comes visiting me unexpectedly asks for coffee 
and I refuse to give him this.

Watching a football game. This remindes me of the time when my 
father was still alive and when we watched football games on TV 
together.
Seeing someone who has bleeding nose.
When I got a good grade for an exam in statistics.

One night at three o'clock I was followed by a cardriver, who 
tried to molest me.

My father promised me a bicycle for my birthday. Just before my 
birthday he forgot he promised this to me.
A younger brother of a good friend of mine died (asthma).

I read a book about torture. The book described exactly how the 
torturing was done.
I had a very pleasant conversation with one of my friends.

I had a dream about my fiancTe leaving me and making an end to 
our relation.
My bicycle was demolished.

During the funeral of my grandmother, when I saw my mother and 
other family members crying.

A fellow student who seemed very nice later on proved to be a 
slimy fellow towards a professor.

This week I was phoned by an old friend with whom I lost contact 
a few years ago.
I was raped by a friend.

Last year I had a friend visiting me for several days. The only 
thing he did was sleeping, drinking, taking pills and thinking 
only about himself.

My girlfriend does practice and therefore leaves me alone at 
night and in the weekend. In addition, she is very busy doing 
several things. So we don't see each other often.

My father suddenly fell ill. He stayed for 3 months in the 
hospital: the last month on intensive care of the Academic 
Hospital, then he died.

Bisshop Ter Schure intoduced himself on TV to the Dutch Nation. 
He spoke as if he was God himself, and didn't discuss the way he 
had achieved this position.

I thought that someone was angry with me but, by hindsight, that 
didn't appear to be the case, he even liked me.

Once, late at night, I was biking home and overtook a man. He 
said to me "Hello darling" I was terrified and imagined the 
wildest scenes.

My parents thought that I didn't do my best to pass the final 
examination (secondary school). When I achieved a good grade they 
said nothing, but if I had had a bad grade they would have become 
very angry.

When I caused much pain and sorrow to my boyfriend by finishing 
our relationship.

When I read about or think about environmental pollution, the 
armor race, starvation, etc. Then one realizes that mankind is 
bad, most important is power and money, at the cost of nature and 
mankind.

A meeting and a conversation with a woman (somewhat elder than 
me) who considers me as her child (she also has one child of her 
own). Last two years I lived with her (no relationship).

As a child I suffered of nightmares. Even since than, I have 
never been so anxious and fearful.

When talking with my sister, she often ventilates prejudices, 
which my father also adheres.

I was in a hopeless situation in a dirty place. No study, no 
work, only loneliness.

It is very difficult to relate it to a certain event. I am 
familiar with the disgust of Sartre (la nausTe), a frequently 
occurring cause may be described as "the self-assured dullness".

When I passed the driving test already on the first try, although 
I felt more and more uncertain as the day came near.

When my father suffered with dizziness. He had to be 
hospitalized, because the physician didn't know what was wrong. 
Because his stools were black, I thought it could be cancer.

When I arranged our holiday in Paris, and my girlfriend raised 
criticisms all the time.

When it suddenly appeared that our dog was dangerously ill and 
probably would die. We had not expected this because he 
was always very healthy. Fortunately he survived because we, in turn, 
gave him medicines during the night.

When a girl in my class (on the secondary school) appeased the 
teacher, resulting in getting a higher grade. This occurred often 
with her.
Passing an examination, although I felt sure I had failed.

I lived in a student-house, where you shared the lavatory and 
shower with a fellow student. the shower cubicle formed the 
connection between both appartments. My neighbour very often was 
drunk and aggressive. One night, I was afraid that he would enter 
my room.

I suffer from a disease of my muscles. Therefore, I am only able 
to attend lectures for half a day. So, sometimes I miss 
obligatory lectures. However, the teachers do not take into 
account my disease, and punish me with detention work, resulting in 
an overload.

I suffer form a disease of my muscles. However, I cannot talk 
about it and my feelings, the consequence with my parents. They 
try to repress it.

Grandfather lives in a home for the elderly. He always looks 
forward to visits. On his birthday (by coincidence it was on 
"Mummy's day") however, nobody went to see him. Is the own family 
more important than grandfather ?
When armed robbers broke into our house at night.

When a pick-pocket robbed me of my money (K20) while I was 
buying bathing soap.
When I failed the grade seven examination.

When my friend who was drunk insulted me in public for no reason at 
all.
The day I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.

When I had gone for a boxing tournament which ended at 2 o'clock 
in the morning. I was alone on my way back, and I could hear the 
barking of the dogs, the nocturnal animals and the sound of my 
own footsteps. There had been a rumour circulating that there 
were ghosts in that area.

In 1983 a sadist provoked my sister in my presence. He tried 
to force my sister into accompanying him to his place, but my 
sister did not agree and so she was kicked and she fell down. 
There was a fight.

When my father passed away in 1978. I was left alone with my 
mother who was very sick so I had to go and live with my aunt, who 
is very short tempered, till my mother was discharged from the 
hospital.
When I learnt that my best friend had failed the exams.

"Boy, you have been admitted to the medicine school and your 
uncle is coming back fron Canada next week," my father told me 
and it was a happy moment.

I was in form five at the boarding school and my friends and I 
had gone drinknig beer in the nearby village. And we were caught 
red handed there by a form master.
When my mother quarrelled with my aunt over me.

My elder brother had been expelled from college and he was so 
frustated that he attempted suicide - he drank bottle fragments. 
I was very sad when I learnt this.

I found out accidentaly that while my uncle was away in Canada, my 
aunt had been bedding a young man on a regular basis.

I won the first prize at the science fair, the first of the kind 
at school and I was only in form II then.

A close relative of mine died in a serious car accident. I was 
one of the first two people to see the corpse and I had to do it. 
Before going in to see it I was afraid as it was the first time 
that I was seeing a corpse.

My younger brother destroyed and gave away some of the books that 
I had intended to keep for as long as possible.

When a close relative of mine passed away, it was the first time 
that someone so close to me had died.

A person whom I thought to be honest took and spend the little 
money that I had and I had no way of getting any money in the 
few following months.

My 21st birthday celebration, when I cut the cake and received 
the presents.

Before one of my final exams of the third year - natural 
sciences.

When some seniors tried to scold and insult some juniors on 
account of what the juniors were supposed to have said at 
secondary school.

When an uncle of mine, who was close to me, passed away after 
having had a stroke, before his first daughter could be named.
When my sister's boyfriend accused her of having been sleeping around.
My fiancT left me for my best friend.
People who discriminate other people disgust me.
A recurrent lovesickness.
I was sexually assaulted one night by a stranger.

Meddlesomeness of my mother about the way I live. She thinks I am 
to free in my behavior for instance when a boyfriend stays the 
night.
The dying of a close member of the family.
Seeing maltreated, dead animals.
When I passed a very important exam.

When a man rang the doorbell and wanted to enter the house with 
violence. I was alone at home that moment.

A friend came to visit me late one night. He promised to stay 
only a quarter of an hour, but he stayed 5 hours !! He didn't 
leave and I was very angry.

I had to terminate a training because I wasn't suited for it. I 
was very sad about this, because I very much wanted to finish 
that training.

During my birthday party a friend drank too much alcohol. So much 
that he had to throw up. Worst of all was that he couldn't leave 
my friend alone and that he was molesting her.
I went to visit friends and it was very companionable.

I wanted to get in contact with a girl I loved, but I was afraid 
she would refuse me.

During military service a superior reproached me unjustly. This 
led to friction in a lot of situations.

Disappointed love. The girl made an end to our relationship while 
I thought she was in love with me.

During military service I heard the story of someone who tried to 
commit suicide and as a result of this got a week custody.

Sitting alone in a quiet room concentrating on things happening 
around me which pleases me.

Sitting alone in a quiet room, concetrating on things happening 
around you. Thoughts come into my mind which make me afraid.

When a teacher tells a story which isn't true. It only reflects 
his way of interpreting reality.

I have high expectations for my future but if I pursue the 
subject in this manner I will not attain this.

I heard a broadcasting programme about parapsychology. The people 
in this programme used very difficult words which I couldn't 
understand. They acted exaggerated without showing any feeling.

My sister and brother in law returned from Sri Lanka where they 
adopted a child. I went to pick them up at the airport.

During a football game I made an offence towards an acquaintance. 
Later on this acquaintance also tackeled me and the game became 
very rude.

I work at a petrol station. When there is a foreigner who wants 
petrol my collegues treat him very impolite.

An uncle of mine who just retired, having worked hard all his 
life, got a cerebral hemorrhage.

A student who lives in the same house where I live is an alcoholic. He 
tries to manipulate other people with his money when he has drunk 
too much.
When I got my drivers licence.

When I stayed alone in a house in Great Brittain and there was a 
lot of rumour in the newspaper about a murderer still being free.
The stories about the way my grandmother treated my mother.
When my mother was proved to suffer from a very serious disease.

The stories about my aunt who was beaten and humiliated by my 
uncle.

Every year during carnival I am very joyful I have an intense 
feeling of happiness then.

The only event I can remember is having a nightmare when I was 
very young (3 years old) I dreamt about a machine which was going 
to crush me.

I am usually angry at myself. This happens often. For instace 
when I want to pet without falling in love and it soon proves 
that I have fallen in love with him.

Losing a boyfriend for the second time to my friend. He fell in 
love with her. The same thing happened a few months earlier with 
another boyfriend.

There is a person whom I disgust. Evrey time I see her I get this 
terrible feeling I disgust her whole appearance.

When I came again in contact with a girl I liked very much. And 
most important she also liked me.

After a hard day at the university I also had to make dinner that 
evening. It failed because of a frying pan which broke.
When my father had a cerebral hemorrhage.

A story I heard recently about a baby dying after sexual 
abuse.

When an old schoolfriend phoned me to arrange an appointment to 
talk about old memories. I hadn't seen him for 8 years.

Standing in a crowed shop or in a closed room with too much 
people in it. This gives me a fearful experience.

My older brother who gives me unwanted advices about problems in 
my relationship with my girlfriend.

My girlfriend left the house in which we lived together a few 
months ago. This made me very sad.

When my parents behave very "witty" towards me, they make insipid 
jokes about which they laugh. Or my mother who treats me like a 
little child.

Occurs frequently. A recent experience: when going out with many 
friends, nice music, after the examinations, I felt so happy I 
could have embraced everybody.

I lived alone in a repulsive area in the city of Rotterdam. I was 
annoyed, heard a lot of Burglary and assaults. Especially in the evening 
and the night I frequently felt anxious.
Being treated unfairly and being hurt by someone I love.

When I finished a relation after four years, leading to much 
sorrow for the other one and myself ("although it was the best 
solution").

Every time I meet a certain person. We cannot get on well 
together, we dislike each other.

I fell over head and ears in love with someone who appeared to be 
in love with me. it made me so happy that I could hardly sleep 
and eat for one week.

One night I had to bike home all alone after a party. Then I 
found out that I was pursued by a man in a car.

I had a quarrel with my father, because I was of the opinion that 
he decided in an authoritarian way which TV program we should 
watch. I became very angry and started throwing things through 
the room.

My boyfriend finished our relationship when I started studying 
psychology in Nijegen, because then we would not be able to meet 
frequently anymore.

A friend had a quarrel with the mother of her boyfriend because 
she and her friend decided to go and live together. She needed 
money for removal, then she made a great effort to reconcile.
I was called and invited to have a talk about a job I wanted to have.

Once late at night (around midnight) a person asked me to give 
him a lift. He suddenly tried to attack me but I could escape. 
After this he followed me for a little while.

There was a lot of irritation between me and a person who lives 
in the same house where I live. Suddenly it became too much for me and I 
accused him of several things.

The end of a relationship (after 4 years) by doing this I hurt 
the other person very much.

I saw a terrible accident in which the driver of a motor was 
thrown through the frontwindow of a car. His face was completely 
away.
When a friend of me came for an unexpected visit.
When I thought the house was on fire at night.

When I was at an official meeting I asked a question to a person. 
His response was not directed at me but at the chairman.
When the mother of a good friend of mine died.

A teacher was very blunt in his relation to a child so that the 
child was very upset when arriving at home.

After I saw my family and good friends back after staying one
